title: Data Engineer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><strong>What You’ll Do</strong><p><br></p><strong>As part of our </strong><strong>Enterprise Data Management team</strong><strong>, you’ll:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develop data-driven solutions with current and next generation technologies to meet evolving business needs. </li><li>Provide technical design and develop Extract/Transform/Load (ETL) applications that interface with all key Discover applications. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>How You’ll Do It</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design and develop data-ingestion frameworks, real-time processing solutions, and data processing and transformation frameworks.  </li><li>Deploy and provide support for application codes and analytical models. </li><li>Provide senior-level technical consulting to peer data engineers during design and development for highly complex and critical data projects. </li><li>Create and enhance data solutions that enable seamless integration and flow of data across the data ecosystem.  </li><li>Provide business analysis and develop ETL code and scripting to meet all technical specifications and business requirements according to the established designs.  </li><li>Develop real-time data ingestion and stream-analytic solutions leveraging technologies such as Kafka, Apache Spark, Python and AWS-based solutions.  </li><li>Work extensively within the Cloud ecosystem and migrate data from Teradata to AWS-based platform.  </li><li>Utilize multiple development languages/tools such as Python, SPARK, Hive, Java to build prototypes and evaluate results for effectiveness and feasibility.  </li><li>Develop application systems that comply with the standard system development methodology and concepts for design, programming, backup, and recovery to deliver solutions that have superior performance and integrity.   </li><li>Contribute to determining programming approach, tools, and techniques that best meet the business requirements.  </li><li>Provide subject matter expertise in the analysis, preparation of specifications and plans for the development of data processes.  </li><li>Offer system support as part of a support rotation with other team members.  </li><li>Operationalize open source data-analytic tools for enterprise use.  </li><li>Ensure data governance policies are followed by implementing or validating data lineage, quality checks, and data classification.  </li><li>Understand and follow the company development lifecycle to develop, deploy and deliver the solutions.    </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications You’ll Need</strong><p><br></p><strong>The Basics:</strong><strong> </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in computer science, or related field  </li><li>4+ years of experience in data platform administration/engineering  </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>6+ years of experience in data platform administration/engineering  </li><li>Knowledge and experience using query languages (SQL, Cypher) for relational and graph databases  </li><li>Willingness to continuously learn &amp; share learnings with others  </li><li>Capability to collaborate with stakeholders and project leaders to understand requirements, deliverables, and set expectations on tasks that you will be responsible for </li><li>Ability to work in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment </li><li>Experience working in an agile and collaborative team environment  </li><li>Design and develop AtScale models based on data modeling of business requirements and entities </li><li>Great understanding of OLAP and dimensional modeling</li><li>Working knowledge in building multi-dimensional cubes, creating dimensions, facts, measures etc</li><li>Proficient in MDX and DAX</li><li>Experience with one or more of the following OLAP tools Microsoft SSAS, MicroStrategy, IBM Cognos etc</li><li>Experience with one or more of the following BI tools Tableau, PowerBI etc</li><li>Experience in solution delivery roles for business intelligence and data analytics</li><li>Experience in working with cloud databases and architectures such as Snowflake, AWS or Azure is a nice to </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)<p><br></p>

title: Data Analyst (19-22/hr)
description: <ul><li>Looking for:* *-Proficient in Excel (Highly proficient skills: create spreadsheets, formulas, Vlook ups and pivot tables is a plus)* *-2-4 years of data heavy position* *-HS Diploma or GED*</li><li>Hours:* Monday through Friday</li><li>8am to 5pm* 2 days in office, 3 days remote</li><li>Description:* The new business job family roles will be responsible for the retrieval, validation, and processing of all worksite and group benefit enrollment files and manual production submissions inclusive of file balancing and audits. The team will be responsible for accurate processing of new enrollments, routing of benefit changes, and handling of termination notifications. Job responsibilities:</li><li>Ability to work with large data sets and run simple formula (VLOOKUP and logic functions are a plus)</li><li>Perform quality assurance and testing to ensure accuracy of setup and ability to process new business</li><li>Retrieve data files from various enrollment platforms and secure server transmissions; validate format and completeness of information received based upon product requirements, and prepare to load into administrative system</li><li>Review state and product compliance requirements, ensure appropriate approvals have been received</li><li>Provide support to field sales, brokers, and employer groups to resolve issues, collect missing information, and ensure accuracy of information received</li><li>Investigate errors that occur on assigned employer groups, research issue and follow through to resolution partnering with internal stakeholders</li><li>Escalate errors and risks as appropriate to bring to resolution and management intervention</li><li>Meet or exceed department established production and quality goals, ensuring service levels are met</li><li>Provide superior customer support to internal and external customers<br><br></li></ul>About Aston Carter:<br><br>Please Note: Scammers are posing as Aston Carter. We'll never contact you via Gmail, Telegram, or WhatsApp and we'll never solicit money from you.<br><br>At Aston Carter, we’re dedicated to expanding career opportunities for the skilled professionals who power our business. Our success is driven by the talented, motivated people who join our team across a range of positions – from recruiting, sales and delivery to corporate roles. As part of our team, employees have the opportunity for long-term career success, where hard work is rewarded and the potential for growth is limitless. Established in 1997, Aston Carter is a leading staffing and consulting firm, providing high-caliber talent and premium services to more than 7,000 companies across North America. Spanning four continents and more than 200 offices, we extend our clients’ capabilities by seeking solvers and delivering solutions to address today’s workforce challenges. For organizations looking for innovative solutions shaped by critical-thinking professionals, visit [AstonCarter.com.](AstonCarter.com) Aston Carter is a company within Allegis Group, a global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law. If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation, such as the modification or adjustment of the job application process or interviewing process due to a disability, please call 888-237-6835 or email [astoncarteraccommodation@astoncarter.com](mailto:%20astoncarteraccommodation@astoncarter.com) for other accommodation options. However, if you have questions about this position, please contact the Recruiter located at the bottom of the job posting. The Recruiter is the sole point of contact for questions about this position.

title: Google Analytics Data Specialist
description: <strong>Opportunity<br><br></strong>Media.Monks is looking for an experienced <strong>Google Analytics Data Specialist</strong> with enterprise-level client facing experience in analytics and implementation of marketing and e-commerce projects. This experience should include helping clients to develop data strategies, complex measurement projects, and experience driving value with expert knowledge and client relationship skills.<br><br>You will be responsible for analytics initiatives, including managing relationships with a number of enterprise clients, building out their analytics framework, overseeing tagging, and ad-hoc reporting needs.<br><br>The ideal candidate <strong>MUST</strong> have a history of working with <strong>Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, </strong>and the <strong>Google Marketing Platform</strong> to help a variety of businesses, overseeing or directly having a hand in the implementation of their data collection, as well as finding ways to utilize this data to drive value for their clients through reporting and analysis.<br><br>This role also offers a huge opportunity for growth within our North America and global data team, the ability to participate in innovation on projects, and the potential to advance the practice of analytics and data from the forefront.<br><br><strong>The Role <br><br></strong><strong>Responsibilities Will Include<br><br></strong><ul><li>Provide subject matter expertise in Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager to your clients via scheduled reports, ad-hoc reports, overseeing the tagging and analytics framework, and a variety of analysis and insight initiatives.</li><li>Develop analytics and data strategies for some of the largest brands in the world with a focus on measurably lifting their business. </li><li>Share your data and marketing analytics expertise with your clients and the MightyHive team; acting as a thought leader for your client, and an active participant in the knowledge growth of the MightyHive team.</li><li>Manage the relationship and projects for enterprise clients</li><li>Assist clients in understanding the importance of online measurement, and provide best practice guidelines for their general data strategy, as well as specific technical implementations.</li><li>Assist the data team in propelling our practice forward with new go to market initiatives and solutions.<br><br></li></ul><strong>What We Are Looking For<br><br></strong>We are looking for candidates that can wear two hats comfortably - “business” and “data” - with at least 2-3 years of client facing experience with Google Analytics. Ideally, this experience is with a digital marketing consulting firm, agency, or advertiser.<br><br>Beyond the experience with Google Analytics, in our eyes the most important qualities are intellectual curiosity, autonomy, and proactivity.<br><br><strong>Required Skills &amp; Experience<br><br></strong><ul><li>You have deep knowledge and experience using Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and other parts of the Google Marketing Platform. </li><li>You have a deep knowledge and understanding of the data, adtech, and martech industry.</li><li>You have experience managing strategic projects and/or clients.</li><li>You’re someone who can sit in a room/Zoom with large clients and confidently establish yourself as a business partner while providing guidance on their analytics and data strategy.</li><li>You lean into a challenge; resilient and are a practitioner of accountability.</li><li>You are a self-directed, resourceful, and a critical thinker with attention-to-detail and problem-solving skills.</li><li>You are someone who loves to collaborate within cross-functional teams.</li><li>You have self and situational awareness; an ability to ‘read the room’; a leader and a listener.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred<br><br></strong><ul><li>You have experience implementing, and utilizing the data from a variety of other digital analytics tools such as Adobe Analytics, Optimize 360, etc. </li><li>You have experience with BI/Data analysis tools (Data Studio, Tableau, PowerBI, etc.).</li><li>Familiarity with cloud data (GCP / BigQuery, AWS, etc) and how to leverage it is a big plus.<br><br></li></ul><strong>What We Offer<br><br></strong><ul><li>Career growth in a disruptor space &amp; entrepreneurial opportunity within the Media.Monks network </li><li>A globally diverse &amp; inclusive culture</li><li>Remote working environment</li><li>Flexible time off + 15 paid holidays</li><li>Company contribution (3%) to 401k, regardless of employee contribution</li><li>Company paid medical, dental, and vision insurance with additional niche benefits</li><li>Base Salary Band: $80,000 - $120,000<br><br></li></ul><strong>About Media.Monks<br><br></strong>Media.Monks is on a mission to create a new future for this industry. Our vision? Build everything with a belief that changing for good comes from changing who does the work. Yep, that means you. Welcome to the party—one global, cross-cultural collective with a passion for using our skills to create better and a better world. That’s how we’re able to connect the dots between data, content, digital media, and technology from everywhere we are—a true end-to-end model. Joining the Media.Monks collective means having the opportunity to create award-winning work with some of the most gifted, focused, joyful, talents from all over the world.<br><br>At Media.Monks, you’ll be joining a highly ambitious company on a global mission to win the decade by changing the industry for good. Partner to 8 of the 10 most innovative companies in the world, Media.Monks works with established as well as up-and-coming global, regional, DTC and B2B brands, helping them own their data and build out customer ecosystems to elicit smart, efficient, high-impact engines for growth. We deliver table stakes quickly, creating cost efficiencies from day one to push up the creative effectiveness of our work with every cycle.<br><br>We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to building a respectful and empowering work environment for all people to freely express themselves amongst colleagues who embrace diversity in all respects. Including fresh voices and unique points of view in all aspects of our business not only creates an environment where we can all grow and thrive but also increases our potential to produce work that better represents—and resonates with—the world around us.<br><br>

Joining the Media.Monks collective means having the opportunity to create award-winning work with some of the most gifted, focused, joyful, talents from all over the world.<br><br>At Media.Monks, you’ll be joining a highly ambitious company on a global mission to win the decade by changing the industry for good. title: Data Engineer
description: <strong>Work with Fortune Global 500 :: New Job Opportunity :: Data Engineer :: Chicago, IL :: Hybrid.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Summary:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>The Product Analytics team at Client's End is on a transformational journey to unlock the full potential of enterprise data build a dynamic diverse and inclusive culture and develop a modern cloud-based data lake architecture to scale our applications and drive growth using data and machine learning. </li><li>Our objective is to enable the enterprise to unleash the potential of data through innovation and agile thinking and to execute on an effective data strategy to transform business processes rapidly accelerate time to market and enable insightful decision making. </li></ul> <strong>Job Overview:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>In this role you will partner with various teams to define and execute data acquisition storage transformation processing and make data actionable for operational and analytics initiatives that create sustainable revenue and share growth. </li><li>This role requires expertise in Client's data sources and technology business intuition and a working knowledge of data transformation and analytical tools. </li><li>Manage data integration and technology projects across the various platforms that comprise Client's data strategy</li><li>Assemble large complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements. </li><li>Identify design and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes optimizing data delivery re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability etc. </li><li>Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction storage transformation and loading ETL of data from a wide variety of data sources</li><li>Work with stakeholders including the Senior management Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs. </li><li>Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems. </li><li>Build and maintain databases data pipelines and data warehouses that provide a comprehensive title: Data Warehouse Engineer
description: The WellBe care model is a Physician Led Advanced Practice clinician driven geriatric care (care of older adults) team focused on the care of the frail, poly-chronic, elderly Medicare Advantage patients. This population is typically underserved and very challenged with access to care. To address these problems, we have elected to bring the care to the patient, instead of trying to bring the patient to the care. Care is provided throughout the entire continuum of care – from chronic care and urgent care in the home, to hospital, to skilled nursing facility, to assisted living, to palliative care, to end of life care. WellBe's physician/advanced practicing clinician led geriatric care teams’ partner with the patient’s primary care physician to provide concierge level geriatric medical care and social support in the home as well as delivering and coordinating across the entire care continuum.<p><br></p><strong><u>General Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>At WellBe Senior Medical our Data Scientist applies advanced data analysis tools and methodologies to deliver insights and actionable recommendations for the business, as well as individual units. Utilizes complex statistical modeling to forecast future outcomes and in various business scenarios. Simplifies results and communicates findings to business leaders.<p><br></p><strong><u>Skills &amp; Competencies</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design and develop ELT pipelines and transformations for publication of data marts to be used for higher level analytics. </li><li>Establish and maintain quality control processes to ensure data is up to date and accurate to maintain the integrity of the data warehouse</li><li>Manage and maintain database roles and permissions to ensure correct availability of data to end users.</li><li>Work alongside data consumers and producers to resolve inquiries and drive changes on upstream dependencies</li><li>Monitor usage and performance of warehouse resources and implement creative solutions for improving performance and reducing costs of said resources</li><li>Ensure proper configuration management and change controls are implemented for your sphere of influence</li><li>Provide technical assistance and cross training to other team members.</li><li>Provide training and assistance to stakeholders</li><li>Design and implement technology best practices, guidelines and repeatable processes.</li><li>Must be able to perform duties with moderate to low supervision</li><li>Other tasks needed to accomplish team’s objectives/goals</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p>Educational/ Experience Requirements:<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree, or higher, and relevant technical discipline such as Statistics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or related field </li><li>7+ years of hands-on experience in with data analysis and predictive analytics machine learning/statistical modeling techniques </li><li>5+ years of experience with programming languages or packages such as Python, R, SQL, etc, including data extraction techniques across multiple database technologies</li><li>Exploratory data analysis skills including understanding, cleaning, transforming, and reducing datasets prior to analysis </li><li>Experience synthesizing and connecting large amounts of data identifying trends and opportunities </li><li>Experience applying statistical methods and math to structured and unstructured data</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Skills And Abilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Strong SQL database development, modeling, and querying skills</li><li>Experience with ELT data integration paradigm and tools like DBT, Fivetran, Rivery, Matillion or similar technologies</li><li>Experience working on data warehousing technologies like Snowflake or BigQuery</li><li>Understanding and experience with dimensional data modeling best practices </li><li>Exposure to healthcare data models.</li><li>Exposure to Cloud infrastructure tools (GCP, AWS, Azure)</li><li>Statistics and analytics experience</li><li>Knowledge of project and information management.</li><li>Excellent interpersonal (verbal and written) communication skills are required to support working in project environments that includes internal, external and customer teams.</li><li>Requires strong analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities.</li><li>Ability to manage multiple priorities, and assess and adjust quickly to changing priorities</li></ul><p><br></p>Supervisory Responsibility: This position will not have supervisory responsibility.<p><br></p>Travel requirements: Travel may be required up to 20% locally or nationally<p><br></p><strong><u>Work Conditions</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to lift up to 20lbs. Moving lifting or transferring of patients may involve lifting of up to 50lbs as well as assist with weights of more than 50bs. </li><li>Ability to stand for extended periods</li><li>Ability to drive to patient locations (ie. home, hospital, SNF, etc)</li><li>Fine motor skills</li><li>Visual acuity </li></ul><p><br></p>The preceding functions may not be comprehensive in scope regarding work performed by an employee assigned to this position classification. Management reserves the right to add, modify, change or rescind the work assignments of this position. Management also reserves the right to make reasonable accommodations so that a qualified employee(s) can perform the essential functions of this role<p><br></p>Job ID: 2023-2542<p><br></p>External Company Name: Wellbe Senior Medical

title: Associate Business Systems Analyst - PeopleSoft
description: <strong>Position:</strong> Associate Business Systems Analyst<p><br></p><strong>Duration:</strong> 6-12+ months<p><br></p><strong>Location:</strong> Chicago, IL 60606<p><br></p>I am looking for a Jr Business Systems Analyst with 2+ years of ERP support experience. In this role you will be joining the HR Technology department, to administer and support the PeopleSoft applications for HR, Talent management, Compensation, Performance Management and Succession Planning.<p><br></p><strong>In this role you will </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Perform basic fixes and data maintenance. </li><li>Help evaluate and test existing system configurations to provide recommendations to increase efficiency, streamline processes, and improve overall usability. </li><li>Provide production support, application maintenance and documentation for all PeopleSoft v9.2 modules including Core HR, Compensation, Performance &amp; Talent Management within scope of responsibility. </li><li>Assist with end user troubleshooting, including but not limited to researching and resolving system problems, system access issues, unexpected results, or process flaws. </li><li>Identify and track issues with assigned applications, working within a ticketing system from issue inception to resolution. </li><li>Partner with team members to troubleshoot and resolve complex problems. </li><li>Assist with project activities as needed including testing, training, and documentation.</li><li>Develop/deliver/maintain end user training and system documentation as needed. </li><li>Look for process improvement opportunities within team procedures and day to day responsibilities. </li><li>Complete required training and actively seek opportunities for professional growth and development. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Strong Customer Service skills and exceptional interpersonal skills</li><li>Best in class communicator - strong oral and written communication skills</li><li>Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience </li><li>Prior experience working in an office environment.</li><li>Microsoft Office proficiency required (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) </li><li>Intermediate to advanced Microsoft Excel skills (e.g., VLOOKUPs, Pivot Tables, etc.) </li><li>Experience with PeopleSoft or an HCM system a plus </li><li>Experience with a case tracking system such as ServiceNow a plus</li><li>Ability to work effectively both independently and as a member of a team. </li><li>Ability to multitask in a highly dynamic environment with a strong attention to detail and commitment to quality. </li><li>Strong learning agility; able to learn new skills, processes, and technologies quickly.</li></ul><p><br></p><em><strong>Did you know about Sterling?</strong></em><em> As a Sterling W2 employee on contract, you are becoming an owner in Sterling. We are an Employee-Owned ESOP (Employee Stock Option Program) Company, that in itself is an additional retirement benefit on top of our other exceptional Sterling benefits, including paid holidays, PTO, the ability to join the 401K with a company match. Sterling Engineering / Staffing could be your future home.</em><p><br></p><strong>Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or genetic information.</strong><p><br></p><strong>#SP</strong>

title: Operations Data Specialist I Surveys
description: <strong>Who we are?</strong> As the world's largest organization of board-certified pathologists and leading provider of laboratory accreditation and proficiency testing programs, the College of American Pathologists (CAP) serves patients, pathologists, and the public by fostering and advocating excellence in the practice of pathology and laboratory medicine worldwide. In 2020, the CAP was recognized as one of the Chicago Tribune’s Top Workplaces for the fifth year. The CAP was also recognized as a socially responsible employer by Center for Companies That Care for the sixth year.<br><br><strong>Our Culture<br></strong><ul><li> CAP employees make a meaningful difference by partnering with colleagues customers and members on challenging and rewarding work </li><li> CAP provides its employees with an energetic and collaborative work environment and encourage opportunities to further develop their skills—offering reimbursement for educational programs and participation in events that enhance your skills </li><li> We offer a generous compensation and benefits package, 401K, and more <br></li></ul><strong><u>Brief Description<br><br></u></strong><strong>The Operations Data Specialist I is accountable for:<br></strong><ul><li>Efficient processing of data for the College of American Pathology laboratory improvement programs to produce participant summaries and evaluations.</li><li>Monitoring all facets of data review and interpretation; entering statistical parameters and grading criteria in SCORES.</li><li>The accuracy of Surveys output while maintaining a dedication to continuous improvements in turnaround time, accuracy, and customer service.</li><li>Working under general supervision with some evaluation, originality, and/or ingenuity. </li><li>Using comprehensive result finding skills and diverse procedures daily. </li><li>Applying some self-directed judgment in primary job functions. </li><li>Serving as a resource for the SCORES operating platform.<br></li></ul><strong>Specific Duties<br><br></strong><strong> Primary duties and responsibilities of the</strong> <strong>Operations Data Specialist I:</strong> <ul><li>Utilize SCORES graphical user interface to create and maintain the appropriate setup structure and system configuration to compile, group, filter, statistically grade, and evaluate Surveys data.</li><li>Work objectively and cooperatively with the Operational/Technical team to facilitate efficient and accurate production and maintenance of SCORES databases, forms, and reports.</li><li>Define page/field mapping of result forms (TELEforms) in accordance to the SCORES bill of material, kit instructions, and other e-LAB Solutions requirements to generate hardcopy and online fulfillment.</li><li>Monitor and direct the data summarization and statistical analysis process using predefined requirements as established by the Technical and Resource Committee staff. </li><li>Maintain continual communication with these entities to actively manage an iterative process of data review and grading refinements before evaluation.</li><li>Initiate and coordinate all activities involved with the generation of SCORES evaluations, including:</li><ul><li>test,</li><li>original,</li><li>late and final, and</li><li>revision evaluations </li></ul><li>Verify the presentation and entitlement of evaluations on the Web (e-LAB Solutions).</li><li>Create professionally formatted participant summary reports from downloaded SCORES data using Microsoft Word, Excel, and Adobe Acrobat. </li><li>Promote these documents to the Web (e-LAB Solutions)</li><li>Review all outputs for completeness and accuracy and assists Technical Specialists with troubleshooting data anomalies.</li><li>Provide guidance to new and fellow Operations Data Specialists.</li><li>Prioritize multiple tasks to efficiently manage a diverse and dynamic project workload.</li><li>Triage non-routine participant requests/issues from Customer Service and Data Capture, replying to phone/email inquiries when necessary.</li><li>Perform functions other than those listed above to ensure proper functioning of the Surveys Department.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Personal<br><br></u></strong><strong>Knowledge / Skills Required / Preferred<br></strong><ul><li>Detail oriented with strong organizational and result finding skills.</li><li>Good verbal and written communication skills.</li><li>Positive attitude/team player.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Professional<br></u></strong><ul><li>Able to prioritize and multi-task many projects simultaneously.</li><li>Able to perform independently.</li><li>Basic knowledge of statistics preferred.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Technical<br></u></strong><ul><li>Microsoft Word</li><li>Microsoft Excel<br></li></ul><strong><u>Education<br><br></u></strong><strong>Education / Experience<br></strong><ul><li>College degree or equivalent, with focus on computer and data management skills preferred.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Experience<br></u></strong><ul><li>1-2 years experience in a professional office environment desirable.<br></li></ul><strong> “The College of American Pathologists requires all new hires to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 prior to the first date of employment. As required by applicable law, The College of American Pathologists will consider requests for Reasonable Accommodations.” <br><br></strong>Equal Opportunity Employer The CAP is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer, providing equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, creed, color, religion, sex, gender identity and/or expression, national origin, age, ancestry, disability or genetic information, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, citizenship status, order of protection status, homelessness, or any other characteristic protected by federal law and the applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.Applicants have rights under Federal Employment Laws: Family and Medical Leave Act Equal Employment Opportunity Employee Polygraph Protection Act<br><br>Apply Now

Data Specialists.</li><li>Prioritize multiple tasks to efficiently manage a diverse and dynamic project workload.</li><li>Triage non-routine participant requests/issues from Customer Service and Data Capture, replying to phone/email inquiries when necessary.</li><li>Perform functions other than those listed above to ensure proper functioning of the Surveys Department.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Personal<br><br></u></strong><strong>Knowledge / Skills Required / Preferred<br></strong><ul><li>Detail oriented with strong organizational and result finding skills.</li><li>Good verbal and written communication skills.</li><li>Positive attitude/team player.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Professional<br></u></strong><ul><li>Able to prioritize and multi-task many projects simultaneously.</li><li>Able to perform independently.</li><li>Basic knowledge of statistics preferred.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Technical<br></u></strong><ul><li>Microsoft Word</li><li>Microsoft Excel<br></li></ul><strong><u>Education<br><br></u></strong><strong>Education / Experience<br></strong><ul><li>College degree or equivalent, with focus on computer and data management skills preferred.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Experience<br></u></strong><ul><li>1-2 years experience in a professional office environment desirable.<br></li></ul><strong> “The College of American Pathologists requires all new hires to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 prior to the first date of employment. As required by applicable law, The College of American Pathologists will consider requests for Reasonable Accommodations.” <br><br></strong>Equal Opportunity Employer The CAP is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer, providing equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, creed, color, religion, sex, gender identity and/or expression, national origin, age, ancestry, disability or genetic information, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, citizenship status, order of protection status, homelessness, or any other characteristic protected by federal law and the applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.Applicants have rights under Federal Employment Laws: Family and Medical Leave Act Equal Employment Opportunity Employee Polygraph Protection Act<br><br>Apply Now

title: Microsoft Engineer
description: <p><span><strong>MOTIVATED…..make IT happen!<br><br></strong></span></p><p><br><br></p><p><span><strong><em><span>Sentinel Technologies, Inc. has been rated a top workplace every year since 2012!<br><br></span></em></strong></span></p><p> <br><br></p><p><span><strong><span>About Us:       <br><br></span></strong></span></p><p><span><strong>Sentinel</strong> delivers solutions that can efficiently address a range of IT needs - from security, to communications, to systems &amp; networks, to software applications, to cloud and managed services; all of which include our staffing solutions for our clients. Since 1982, Sentinel has grown from providing technology maintenance services to our current standing as one of the leading IT services and solutions provider in the US. We have aligned with many of today’s global technology leaders including Cisco, Dell, VMware and Microsoft. Sentinel services customers both nationally and internationally with primary support operating centers in Downers Grove (HQ), Chicago, and Springfield, IL; Phoenix, AZ.; Detroit, Lansing, and Grand Rapids, MI; Milwaukee, WI; Denver, CO; and Fort Lauderdale, FL. <br><br></span></p><p><span> <br><br></span></p><p><span>If you are MOTIVATED… you can make IT happen at Sentinel. Our commitment to our employees is to create a work environment that encourages creativity, an entrepreneurial spirit, fosters growth through certification and hands-on training, and values a team-oriented culture with rewards based on impact! <br><br></span></p><p><span> <br><br></span></p><p><span>If you share our passion about what technology can do and want to be part of a top workplace environment - we’d like to have you join our team.  Learn more at <span>www.sentinel.com/careers</span>. <br><br></span></p><p><span> <br><br></span></p><p><span>As part of Sentinel's employment process, candidates will be required to complete a background check. Only those who meet the minimum requirements will be contacted. No phone calls please.<br><br></span></p><p><span> <br><br></span></p><p><span>Sentinel is proud to be an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, marital status, genetics, disability, pregnancy, veteran status or any other basis protected by law.<br><br></span></p><p><span> <br><br></span></p><p><span>If you are an individual with a disability and need assistance in applying for a position, please contact SentinelHR1@sentinel.com.<br><br></span></p><p> <br><br></p><p><span>Sentinel is seeking Microsoft engineer proficient in Microsoft solutions including Azure, O365, Active Directory, Active Directory Domain Services and Exchange. In this role you will be working with various customers and their systems to ensure any migrations, support, and implementations are completed accurately and timely.  If you are looking for a role that brings a lot of variety of work to your day with high scope of growth and advancement, this role is for you! <strong>This is a full-time position located in Downers Grove, IL.<br><br></strong></span></p><p> <br><br></p><ul><li><span>Experience with Microsoft Cloud Technologies such as Azure, O365, Active Directory, Exchange online</span></li><li><span>Experience with Active Directory Domain controllers in the development and production environment</span></li><li><span>Windows Server including the use of Hyper V or VMWare. </span></li><li><span>Basic support experience with Networking and Storage</span></li><li><span>Intermediate PowerShell experience</span></li><li><span>Excellent communication skills</span></li><li><span>The candidate must have a car, as this position requires travel between location and the transportation of equipment </span></li><li><span>A valid driver’s license and proof of vehicle insurance will be required</span></li><li><span><strong><span>Legally authorized to work in the US without sponsorship</span></strong></span></li><li><span>Must demonstrate a “can-do” attitude</span></li></ul><p><span> <br><br></span></p><p><span>We focus on candidates that display our “ACE” factor - Attitude, Compassion, and Enthusiasm to deliver quality solutions with exceptional customer service. <br><br></span></p><p><span><strong> <br><br></strong></span></p><p><span><strong><span>What you get:<br><br></span></strong></span></p><p><span>We offer an energetic work environment with many corporate culture amenities, competitive salary, and rich benefit plan including: Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, 529, Life Insurance, Income Protection Short and Long-Term Disability, Medical and Child/Elder Care, Flexible Spending Account Plans, Employee Assistance Program, Two weeks vacation, additional paid time-off for Personal and Sick, certification and hands-on training, and discounts for local event entertainment and health clubs.</span></p>

title: Applications Engineer
description: <p>ST is a global semiconductor leader delivering intelligent and energy-efficient products and solutions that power the electronics at the heart of everyday life. ST’s products are found everywhere today, and together with our customers, we are enabling smarter driving and smarter factories, cities, and homes, along with the next generation of mobile and Internet of Things devices. By getting more from technology to get more from life.</p><p><br></p><p><br></p><p>ST is excited to welcome a Power Applications Engineer at our office located in <strong>Schaumburg, Illinois</strong>. The primary responsibilities for this role are:</p><p><br></p><ul><li>Support ST’s customer designing and developing power circuits and systems that will meet specific performance and reliability requirements.</li><li>Evaluating the performance of power and discrete components to select the best suited components for an application.</li><li>Testing/verifying circuit designs to identify any issues or improvements needed.</li><li>Provide technical support/training to both internal and external customers.</li></ul><p><br></p><p>Minimum Requirements:</p><p>· BS or greater in Electrical Engineering</p><p>· 6-10 years of experience</p><p>· Strong verbal and written communication skills</p><p>· Demonstrated strong interpersonal, analytical, and problem-solving skills.</p><p>· Ability to take the initiative and drive results.</p><p>· Orcad/Altium design experience</p><p>· High voltage (200v and higher) circuit design/testing experience</p><p>· LTSpice experience</p><p>· Power semiconductor component understanding</p><p><br></p><p><br></p><p>Preferred Qualifications:</p><p>· Motor control design/component level selection</p><p>· Analog/Digital SMPS</p><p>· DC/DC Converter and topologies</p><p>· Onboard Charger and topologies</p><p>· C Programming</p><p><br></p><p>STMicroelectronics is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. STMicroelectronics is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, disability, genetic information, age, national origin, sex, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristic.</p><p><br></p><p><br></p><p>At STMicroelectronics, base salary is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range depending on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. The base <strong>annual salary</strong> range for this role is between $113,280- 161,400 USD.</p>

title: Applications Engineer
description: Ingersoll Rand is committed to achieving workforce diversity reflective of our communities. We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.<br><br>The Application Engineer is primarily responsible for sizing, selecting, and configuring Ingersoll Rand products and solutions to our customers’ specifications and expectations. This position reports to Engineering, but also operates as an integral part the entire Sales Team to supports the selling efforts of the direct sales force. The Application Engineer oversees project documentation with testing and modifying the products in all stages of the process. The position requires an unwavering commitment to “Make Life Better” for our customers to significantly grow our business as well as the discipline and brilliance to effectively service our distributors and internal Sales team.<br><br><strong>Essential Duties And Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li> Support size/selection/configuration of products and solutions to satisfy customers/distributors/direct sales team </li><li> Develop competitive project proposals for EPCs and execute to customer expectations with Least Waste Way Project Plan (LWWPP) cross functional team. </li><li> Develop drawings/models consistent for customer/application requirements, guidelines and standards. Verify drawings for clarity, completeness and conformity to standards. </li><li> Recommend appropriate product or design solutions for all products. </li><li> Consult with design engineers regarding approvals by product line. </li><li> Support and critical interaction with Sales Team, Manufacturing, and Sourcing. </li><li> Finalize design and create prints for production as guided with Engineering. </li><li> Support Sales with CAD, 3D drawings and BOM creation with supporting item master add. </li><li> Perform non-production project test requirements. </li><li> Support Outside Sales Team with issue resolution and order support. </li><li> Support quote process and understand pricing and margin expectations. </li><li> Actively send feedback to Product Management MLB strategy </li><li> Align and support tasks and activities related to SQDIP expectations with Safety as a top Ingersoll Rand expectation </li><li> All other duties as assigned. </li><li> Demonstrates excellence in completion of all other duties as assigned. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li> Bachelor of Science Degree in Engineering, Mechanical Engineering preferred </li><li> 5 years relevant work experience </li><li> Manufacturing experience a plus </li><li> Intermediate/Advanced SolidWorks skill and ability </li><li> Proficient with PumpGuru applications knowledge base </li><li> Intermediate computer skills and proficient in Microsoft Office required </li><li> Ability to demonstrate advanced SAP mainframe skill set </li><li> Knowledge with design, engineering applications, project development, contract agreements, and discount structures for all products </li><li> Team oriented and customer focused </li><li> Ability to manage multiple priorities and respond quickly to department and customer requests </li><li> Ability to demonstrate technical and product knowledge orientation with multiple product lines, parts, pricing, discount/commission schedules, and margin scale </li><li> Solid organizational and priority management skills </li><li> Technical, administrative, and critical thinking capabilities </li><li> Competitive market and innovative solution understanding </li><li> Possess ability to interact with all levels of the organization <br><br></li></ul>Physical Requirements<br><ul><li> Works at a desk with a PC and a telephone for hours at a time </li><li> Travel by conventional means may be required occasionally – up to 10% of the time </li><li> Works within a manufacturing environment, with occasional exposure to noise, heat, cold, fumes, and chemicals. </li><li> Need to be able to lift a maximum of 50 pounds. <br><br></li></ul>Ingersoll Rand Inc. (NYSE:IR), driven by an entrepreneurial spirit and ownership mindset, is dedicated to helping make life better for our employees, customers and communities. Customers lean on us for our technology-driven excellence in mission-critical flow creation and industrial solutions across 40+ respected brands where our products and services excel in the most complex and harsh conditions. Our employees develop customers for life through their daily commitment to expertise, productivity and efficiency. For more information, visit www.IRCO.com.

title: Axiom Developer
description: <p><strong>Role:&nbsp;Axiom Developer, </strong></p><p><strong>Location: 100% Remote</strong></p><p><strong>Duration: 12 Months&nbsp;</strong></p><p><br></p><p><em>Required Skills: </em>2-3 years with AxiomSL Controller View Exp with Development Exp with Axiom reports</p><p><br></p><p><strong>Qualifications;</strong></p><p>• Minimum of 6 to 8 years of IT Development experience with minimum of 3 years of Axiom SL controller view development experience is a must.</p><p>• Must have the ability to create Axiom objects such As Data Sources, Data Models, Shorthand’s, Portfolios, Aggregations along with other data mapping activities.</p><p>• Must have prior experience in mapping and configuring free form reports, tabular reports and automation of Axiom workflows.</p><p>• Prior experience on configuring APAC taxonomy reports (Singapore, Australia) and EMEA regulatory reporting initiatives is must.</p><p>• Prior experience and knowledge on US regulatory reports is a benefit – FFIEC031, FFIEC041, FFIEC009 etc.,</p><p>• Work in the role of an Axiom Developer in a fast-paced environment, must be a self-starter, comfortable dealing with clients, VERY strong communication skills.</p><p>• Must have the ability to review project related documents such as BRD, FSD and understand the design and solutions architecture with minimal guidance.</p><p>• Hands on development of ETL jobs, Shell scripting and delivering the functionality details in technical specifications.</p><p>• Development and review of PL SQL &amp; other DB code to support date sourcing into Axiom.</p><p>• Ensuring code written meets the predefined company and departments standards.</p><p>• Must have prior performance tuning experience both inside the Axiom controller view as well as at the DB level.</p><p>• Preparation and execution of detailed unit test cases.</p><p>• Creation of Data Sources, Data Models, Shorthand’s, Portfolios, Aggregations, Fee Form and Tabular Report and workflows using AXIOM controller view tool based on Regulatory report requirements.</p><p>• Migration of Axiom components from one environment to another.</p><p>• Understanding the Functional documents and work with BA/Users to develop the reports.</p><p>• Good experience in Regulatory Reporting and Data Warehousing</p><p><br></p><p>Thanks &amp; Regards</p><p>Syam B, 630-923-6952</p><p>syam@thoughtwavesoft.com</p>

title: Test Engineer
description: <strong><u>Company Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>Sterling Site Access Solutions LLC is a national vertically integrated site access service provider to the North American Energy Infrastructure Marketplace. An Illinois based company, with facilities located across the country, including regional construction offices, distribution centers and world class manufacturing facilities. As a data driven company, Sterling provides complete turnkey ground protection products and services to the transmission &amp; distribution, renewables, civil and oil &amp; gas markets. Sterling is committed to developing our employees, providing best in class customer service and being responsible stewards of the environment.<p><br></p><strong><u>Position Overview</u></strong><p><br></p>The R&amp;D Test Engineer must be task-oriented, extremely adaptable and possess exceptional, out-of-the-box problem solving ability. This position will lead critical R&amp;D projects through the testing and validation process.<p><br></p><strong><u>Essential Functions &amp; Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Consistently demonstrate commitment and support for the Sterling Vision and Mission, policies, and procedures.</li><li>Pursue Continuous Improvement activities to ensure efficiency and effectiveness within area of responsibility.</li><li>Assume other responsibilities and complete tasks as assigned to meet the on-going needs of the organization.</li><li>Represent company in technical organizations, trade shows and sales demos. </li><li>Manage all phases of the Product Development Stage-Gate Process including:</li></ul> <u> Discovery </u><p><br></p><ul><li>Research and suggest new materials, methods and approaches based upon team objectives. </li><li>Assess high-level business case and feasibility.</li></ul> <u> Scope </u><p><br></p><ul><li>Identify necessary technical requirements, restraints, specifications &amp; certifications.</li><li>Create and manage project timeline.</li></ul> <u> Development </u><p><br></p><ul><li>Engineer solutions, produce prototypes, obtain samples.</li><li>Develop testing procedures, processes and standards. </li><li>Train team and external resources to perform testing . </li><li>Determine sourcing, tooling, cost monitoring and test plan.</li></ul> <u> Testing / Validation </u><p><br></p><ul><li>Execute test plans, manage field studies and validate certification actions.</li><li>Process data and analyze results.</li><li>Iterate through scope, development and testing phases until project outcomes are confirmed.</li></ul> <strong> EDUCATION, TRAINING, CERTIFICATIONS &amp; EXPERIENCE</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Preferred - Bachelor of Science in Wood, Engineering, Data and Analytics, Materials or similar </li><li>Extensive lab testing, testing design and data analysis experience </li><li>Minimum 5 years' experience in wood science or advanced degree </li></ul> <strong> SKILLS &amp; KNOWLEDGE</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Subject matter expertise in materials, testing design, testing procedures and testing management, etc. </li><li>Character consistent with the Sterling Values and Business Code of Conduct &amp; Ethics. </li><li>Portray a consistent, positive and winning attitude with a team mindset. </li><li>Self-starter, ability to handle criticism, flexible, works well with limited direction. </li><li>Project management expertise and demonstratable experience </li><li>Expertise in data aggregation, analysis, and presentation </li><li>Proven leadership and collaboration skills with the ability to effectively supervise, coach, and influence employees, vendors and service providers. </li><li>Strong analytical skills to analyze complex business processes and identify risk in high visibility, and high stress situations; quickly and accurately apply sound, well-balanced reasoning to each decision. </li><li>Ability to identify opportunities to increase accuracy, optimize resources and implement solutions. </li><li>Strong time and project management skills with ability to multitask and prioritize workloads. </li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills; able to present clean, organized and thorough information and data appropriate for intended audience. </li><li>Experience or trainable in forklift operation, wood working equipment and hand tools. </li><li>Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), MS Project, LabVIEW, MatLab, CAD software Project Management Software; ability to learn and achieve proficiency in new software applications. </li></ul> <strong> ACKNOWLEDGEMENT: </strong> This job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to the role.

title: Azure AD Security Engineer
description: <strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Design, implement and operate security controls for various services in the Microsoft and Amazon cloud, with a primary focus in Azure AD. -Design and implement access control policies within Azure AD and MDM. -Analyze requirements and apply knowledge of business needs and security risks to determine appropriate course of action. -Collaborate with different areas of IT in order to provide security and business technology solutions for the Bank. -Development of security policy, standard, procedure and design documents. -Design, engineer, and deploy technologies for application integrations for using SAML, Open ID, or OAuth -Act as a point of escalation for issues relating to security controls or tools, including (but not limited to) SSO, MFA, certificates. -Design, implement and operate security controls for various services in Office 365, with an emphasis on Azure AD identity -Understanding of OAuth and assist with the interface with Azure APIs -Occasionally provide support off-hours when business critical problems arise. Software Requirements - Active Directory (On-Prem) - Azure Active Directory -Azure AD Conditional Access -Windows Servers (2016 and newer) -Azure AD Seamless SSO Preferred: - CyberArk (Preferred) - Azure B2C (preferred) - Azure Application Proxy (preferred) Additional Responsibilities: o Scripting/automation experience such as Python, PowerShell and API integrations o Contribute to design and execute delivery for technologies that improve overall security posture or technology service delivery within the organization. o Analyze requirements and apply knowledge of business needs and security risks to determine appropriate course of action. o Develop security standards and procedures to ensure appropriate controls throughout the technology environment. o Collaborate with different areas of IT in order to provide security and business technology solutions for the bank.<p><br></p><strong><u>Skills</u></strong><p><br></p>Azure AD, Authorization, Conditional Access, SSO<p><br></p><strong><u>Top Skills Details</u></strong><p><br></p>Azure AD,Authorization,Conditional Access,SSO<p><br></p><strong><u>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p>Ability to work with a team Able to go onsite two days a week<p><br></p><strong><u>Experience Level</u></strong><p><br></p>Expert Level<p><br></p><strong><u>About Us</u></strong><p><br></p>Skiltrek is an award-winning IT staffing firm and the staffing partner of choice for many leading companies across the US.<p><br></p>At Skiltrek, we promise you the perfect opportunity of building technical excellence, understand business performance and nuances,<p><br></p>be abreast with the latest happenings in technology world and enjoy a satisfying work life balance.<p><br></p>Skiltrek is committed to equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to gender,<p><br></p>race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law.<p><br></p>Skiltrek is an equal opportunity employer; title: Security Engineer
description: The Mom Project is excited to partner with <strong>Federal Home Loan Bank Chicago</strong> in their search for a<strong> Security Engineer (Hybrid 1-2 days in Chicago office)</strong><p><br></p>Federal Home Loan Bank Chicago is a wholesale bank and one of 11 district FHLBanks chartered in 1932 by the U.S. Congress to support mortgage lending and community investment. Each FHLBank operates as an independent organization and is governed by a board of directors elected by its member institutions. As a cooperative, we provide reliable liquidity to our member banks, credit unions, insurance companies, and community development financial institutions located in Illinois and Wisconsin, focusing on the distinct needs of their individual businesses and communities.<p><br></p>FHLBC is committed to creating a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace where employees are fully engaged and positioned to do their best work in support of our organization's goals.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design, implement and operate security controls for various services in the Microsoft and Amazon cloud, with a primary focus in Azure AD. </li><li>Design and implement access control policies within Azure AD and MDM. </li><li>Occasionally provide support off-hours when business critical problems arise. </li><li>Analyze requirements and apply knowledge of business needs and security risks to determine appropriate course of action. </li><li>Collaborate with different areas of IT in order to provide security and business technology solutions for the Bank. </li><li>Development of security policy, standard, procedure and design documents. </li><li>Design, engineer, and deploy technologies for application integrations for using SAML, Open ID, or OAuth </li><li>Act as a point of escalation for issues relating to security controls or tools, including (but not limited to) SSO, MFA, certificates. </li><li>Occasionally provide support off-hours when business critical problems arise. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Technical Skills Required</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Active Directory (On-Prem) </li><li>Azure Active Directory </li><li>CyberArk (Preferred) </li><li>Windows Servers (2016 and newer) </li><li>Azure B2C (preferred) </li><li>Azure Application Proxy (preferred)</li></ul>

title: Web Developer
description: <strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Incorporated (AKA) is seeking to fill the position of Web Developer. This position is responsible for using their knowledge of programming languages to code websites and web applications. In addition, the individual in this role will assist members and Corporate Office staff with reporting and technical support.<p><br></p>This position will closely collaborate with Corporate Office staff and AKA members to support sorority operations. The role is accountable for building and deploying new front-end features to our WordPress website and developing and deploying digital marketing assets. As well as designing, writing, and editing website content while understanding UI, cross-browser compatibility, and general web functions and standards.<p><br></p>Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Incorporated is a non-profit international membership organization with more than 320,000 college trained members bound by bonds of sisterhood and empowered by a commitment of servant-leadership.<p><br></p>The organization focuses in two key areas: lifelong personal and professional development for all of its members; and galvanizing its membership into an organization of respected power and influence constantly at the forefront of effective advocacy and social change that results in equality and equity for all citizens of the world.<p><br></p><em><strong>General Responsibilities</strong></em><p><br></p><ul><li>Optimize user experience and site content including HTML, site structure, page layout and navigation.</li><li>Build email marketing campaigns in collaboration with corporate communications team.</li><li>Adhere to the organization’s core values and operations tenants. </li><li>Perform ongoing maintenance of WordPress website.</li><li>Research, troubleshoot and resolve member issues in an accurate and timely manner.</li><li>Interface with members and vendors regarding website needs.</li><li>Identify technology needs and make recommendations to business decision makers.</li><li>Use effective communication skills when responding to member emails and attending meetings.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field. </li><li>3 (Three) years’ hands-on web development work experience. </li><li>Demonstrated intermediate proficiency with WordPress/PHP, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, MySQL, and Salesforce.</li><li>Experience integrating front-end code with server-side technology.</li><li>Extensive experience managing third-party vendors.</li><li>Excellent written and exceptional verbal communications and interpersonal skills.</li><li>Must be detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills.</li><li>Must be able to multi-task, meet tight deadlines, and maintain composure under pressure in a fast-paced environment.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Please include your cover letter with resume when you apply.</strong>

title: DevOps Support Engineer
description: *Hybrid, 3 days onsite, 2 days remote*<p><br></p>A prestigious financial firm needs a DevOps Support Engineer. This engineer will focus on DevOps support, maintenance, and configuration of development environments in Kubernetes and AWS. This individual will need to possess skills with Java, Python, AWS, DevOps, CICD, Kubernetes, Kafka, Jenkins, Github, Ansible, etc.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Enable development teams to self-service build and deployment processes through process automation.</li><li>Design and implement process improvements across the build, deployment, and monitoring of Clearing applications.</li><li>Support the maintenance and configuration of development environments in Kubernetes and AWS.</li><li>Develop and support terraform, ansible, Harness, and Jenkins jobs used to instantiate and manage development environments.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>BS degree in Computer Science, similar technical field, or equivalent experience</li><li>1+ years of experience in building large scale, data-centric solutions</li><li>3+ years of experience (recent) participating on a DevOps team or as product owner for DevOps team</li><li>Programming/scripting experience in languages like Java, Bash, Python or Go is required. </li><li>Knowledge and experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) tools (examples - GitHub, Jenkins, Artifactory, Docker, Compose, K8s).</li><li>Java development experience is desirable.</li><li>Experience with distributed message brokers like Kafka, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, Amazon Kinesis, etc.</li><li>Experience with cloud technologies and migrations is required. </li><li>Experience preferred with AWS foundational services like VPCs, Security groups, EC2, RDS, S3 ACLs, KMS, AWS CLI and IAM etc.</li><li>Experience developing and delivering technical solutions using public cloud service providers like Amazon, Google, etc.</li><li>Familiarity with monitoring related tools and frameworks like Splunk, ElasticSearch, Prometheus, AppDynamics. Working knowledge of DevOps tools. Eg Terraform, Ansible, Jenkins, Kubernetes, Helm and CI/CD pipeline etc. is required. </li><li>Experience with RESTful APIs and JSON RPC. Experience following Git workflows.</li></ul>

title: Software Engineer
description: Come for the mission. Stay for the experience.<br><br>Let's keep things simple: we are an unbelievably talented, hard-working, and compassionate team driving towards a mission that impacts every single one of us - even you!<br><br>Healthcare benefits are complex, underutilized and a mystery for most users. We're removing that complexity. Now more than ever, employers are adding value to their employees' benefits like telemedicine and mental health services. HealthJoy's industry-changing tech platform consolidates those benefits into a simplified benefits experience, saving users time and money.<br><br>With over $100M in fundraising to date, and the successful closing of our recent Series D, HealthJoy has garnered workplace awards for Inc.'s Fastest Growing Startups and Built In Chicago's Best Places to Work while growing globally to nearly 400 team members. We're continuing down the path of high growth and high impact, and this role is a key member of the Marketing Team making that happen.<br><br>Your impact.<br><br>We are looking for an ambitious Software Engineer with a deep desire to learn and develop software that improves people's lives. If you're passionate about developing the best software and collaborating with other developers to do so, then we want to hear from you!<br><br>You will enhance our SaaS solution, scale highly distributed systems, and continuously improve our engineering practices. You will get to work on the latest software practices and technologies such as microservices architecture, cloud design patterns, automated CI/CD pipeline, automated and orchestrated Dockerized delivery, and AWS platform. Above all, your work will impact people's interactions with the healthcare system.<br><ul><li>Collaborate on architectural decisions and design best practices</li><li>Design and implement new features into the HealthJoy platform</li><li>Works to develop relationships with internal and external stakeholders to understand business and technical requirements </li><li>Collaborate with engineering and product team members to improve quality and velocity</li><li>Creating a scalable solution to serve our growing user base<br><br></li></ul>Your experience.<br><ul><li>2-4 years experience building and shipping scalable applications in Python, JavaScript</li><li>Some experience developing on backend frameworks such as Asyncio, Aiohttp, Flask, SQLAlchemy, React or equivalent</li><li>Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and some experience working with them</li><li>Basic understanding of microservices architecture and some experience working in this type of architecture</li><li>Some exposure to the AWS ecosystem, but not necessarily extensive experience</li><li>Good communication and interpersonal skills</li><li>Developing a sense of ownership and self-drive from the first line of code to the impact on the end user</li><li>Some exposure to participating in the architecture and design of new and existing products, but not necessarily leading these efforts</li><li>An eagerness to learn and share knowledge with others, but not necessarily expected to be a mentor to junior engineers</li><li>Curiosity to learn new software principles, technologies, and tools</li><li>Willingness to collaborate with developers and testers <br><br></li></ul>Total Rewards<br><br>Job Level: 30<br><br>Base Compensation Range for Job Level: $80,000 - $140,000 Annually<br><br>The cash compensation above includes base salary only. Certain roles are eligible for additional cash incentives such as commission, annual bonus targets, overtime pay or other variable incentives.<br><br>HealthJoy maintains a comprehensive strategy to determine rewarding and competitive packages for individual compensation for new hires, internal promotions and internal job changes. This strategy is based on several factors unique to each individual, including: 1) the skills, experience and qualifications of the individual; 2) the responsibilities and demands of the role; 3) analysis of external market data; and 4) company budget and financial performance.<br><br>HealthJoy is a remote-first employer. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled.<br><br>At HealthJoy, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role, and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each role and individual.<br><br>In addition to cash compensation, HealthJoy offers a rich "Total Rewards" package that includes:<br><ul><li>Medical, Dental and vision insurance packages</li><li>Stock options for eligible roles</li><li>401k match</li><li>Paid parental leave</li><li>Company sponsored Short Term and Long Term Disability coverage</li><li>Flexible PTO <br><br></li></ul>Commitment to Equal Pay<br><br>At HealthJoy, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone has the opportunity to succeed and thrive.<br><br>We believe that everyone should be paid based on their qualifications, experience, and the work that they do, and not on their gender, race, or any other personal characteristic. Our compensation practices are essential to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where we value the contributions of all our employees.<br><br>We conduct thorough annual reviews of employee pay and our pay practices to ensure we reward the right behaviors and are providing equal pay for equal work.<br><br>Additionally, we assess the external market and internal equity across like roles. As part of our regular review of pay practices, HealthJoy examines employee pay for potential disparities between persons of different genders, races and ethnicities that are not explainable by objective factors such as performance, experience level, credentials, or location, and are committed to correcting any issues and reviewing practices from unintended outcomes.

Our compensation practices are essential to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where we value the contributions of all our employees.<br><br>We conduct thorough annual reviews of employee pay and our pay practices to ensure we reward the right behaviors and are providing equal pay for equal work.<br><br>Additionally, we assess the external market and internal equity across like roles. As part of our regular review of pay practices, HealthJoy examines employee pay for potential disparities between persons of different genders, races and ethnicities that are not explainable by objective factors such as performance, experience level, credentials, or location, and are committed to correcting any issues and reviewing practices from unintended outcomes.

title: Application Engineer
description: <ul><li>Description:*</li><li>Profile new applications with customers, including functional specifications, project timelines and cost targets.</li><li>Plan and modify product configurations to meet customer needs.</li><li>Generate price quotations for customers, including technical submittal information.</li><li>Troubleshoot and provide technical support for chillers in the field</li><li>Select and source major components for custom designs with Engineering.</li><li>Support Engineering and Manufacturing in the design and assembly process to ensure all customer</li><li> requirements are met.</li><li>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications:*</li><li>Bachelors of Engineering (Mechanical, Electrical, Chemical).</li><li>Minimum 5-7 years of work experience</li><li>Computer Skills: proficient with Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook and Power Point. Aptitude to learn ERP system</li><li> and processes.<br><br></li></ul>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference.
