title: Assoc Business Analyst - Hybrid Oak Brook, IL
description: <u><strong>Must be willing to report in office two days a week in Oak Brook, IL. </strong></u><p><br></p>We're powering a cleaner, brighter future.<p><br></p>Exelon is leading the energy transformation, and we're calling all problem solvers, innovators, community builders and change makers. Work with us to deliver solutions that make our diverse cities and communities stronger, healthier and more resilient.<p><br></p>We're powered by purpose-driven people like you who believe in being inclusive and creative, and value safety, innovation, integrity and community service. We are a Fortune 200 company, 19,000 colleagues strong serving more than 10 million customers at six energy companies -- Atlantic City Electric (ACE), Baltimore Gas and Electric (BGE), Commonwealth Edison (ComEd), Delmarva Power &amp; Light (DPL), PECO Energy Company (PECO), and Potomac Electric Power Company (Pepco).<p><br></p>In our relentless pursuit of excellence, we elevate diverse voices, fresh perspectives and bold thinking. And since we know transforming the future of energy is hard work, we provide competitive compensation, incentives, excellent benefits and the opportunity to build a rewarding career.<p><br></p>Are you in?<p><br></p><strong><u>Primary Purpose Of Position</u></strong><p><br></p>Perform analysis and prepare standard reports to support business operations. Conduct basic modeling, forecasting, trending, variance analysis, business case development, and other financial and operational analysis. Monitor and coordinate activities to support operational performance management (e.g., safety, reliability, service level, productivity, etc.). Track, maintain, analyze and provide current and relevant information on the operation's business scorecard or key performance indicators (KPIs). Support the development of performance reports for both internal and external use. Support the short-term and long-range business planning process. Provide analytical and operational support to the business unit. Position may be required to work extended hours for coverage during storms or other energy delivery emergencies.<p><br></p><strong><u>Primary Duties And Accountabilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> The following duties and accountabilities are those typically performed by the business analyst job family in Energy Delivery. The specific duties, accountabilities and percentage of time may vary depending on the department and/or functional area needs. If appropriate, a specific departmental position description may by developed and kept by the departmental manager with a specific list of duties and accountabilities for this position. </li><li> Support the short-term and long-range business planning process. Conduct basic modeling, forecasting, trending, variance analysis, business case development, and other financial and operational analysis (e.g., operational effectiveness, budget, resource, workload, workforce and capacity utilization, competitor, etc.). </li><li> Develop and provide relevant statistical information to ensure the most effective utilization of personnel, equipment and/or materials for business operations. </li><li> Monitor and coordinate the business unit's activities to support operational performance management (e.g., safety, reliability, service level, productivity, etc.). </li><li> Track, maintain, analyze and provide current information on the operation's business scorecard or key performance indicators (KPIs). </li><li> Perform analysis of the operation's cost elements to ensure effective and efficient operations. </li><li> Prepare and analyze standard reports. </li><li> Support the development of detailed performance reports for both internal and external use. </li><li> Provide analytical and operational support to the business unit. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>JOB SCOPE</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> This is an individual contributor position that works under direct supervision and follows standard procedures to accomplish assigned tasks. This position is expected to resolve general questions and problems and determines when to refer more complex issue to higher levels. </li><li> May require working extended hours and/or shift work to support business operations. </li></ul> <strong>MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Business or Engineering AND 0 - 2 years relevant business experience, or in lieu of Bachelor's degree, a minimum of 1 - 3 years relevant business experience is required. </li><li>Basic understanding of applicable standards, methods, processes and practices, business fundamentals, and performance metrics in the specific functional area supported by this position (e.g., asset management, electric or gas operations, customer service, transmission and substation, distribution system operations, regulatory and external affairs, transmission operations and planning). </li><li>Basic proficiency in standard software applications (e.g., Microsoft Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Project), business technologies and specialized business applications (e.g., workforce management, project management, PassPort, Brio, CIS, EPS, Business Objects, SAP planning, business modeling, forecasting, voice response unit, automatic call distributors, work management, outage management). </li><li>Ability to provide basic analysis and apply managerial accounting concepts, customer intelligence gathering, forecasting, staff planning, scheduling, analytical and statistical problem solving, financial, accounting, business and budget analysis. </li><li>Basic analytical skills for project evaluation including analysis of departmental projects with economic, financial, risk and decision analysis. Limited experience in business case development. </li><li>Customer driven with good oral and written communications skills and basic analytical, problem solving and project management skills. </li><li>Knowledge of the practices, procedures and principles of performance analysis (trending, root cause and gap analysis) benchmarking and audit compliance. Ability to analyze organizational data and basic problems, interpret and recommend alternative courses of action.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p>Bachelor's degree<p><br></p><strong>Primary Location</strong><p><br></p>US-IL-OAK BROOK<p><br></p><strong>Other Locations</strong><p><br></p>US-Hybrid Remote<p><br></p><strong>Work Locations</strong><p><br></p>ComEd Commercial Center<p><br></p><strong>Job</strong><p><br></p>Customer Service<p><br></p><strong>Organization</strong><p><br></p>ComEd<p><br></p><strong>Schedule</strong><p><br></p>Full-time<p><br></p><strong>Employee Status</strong><p><br></p>Regular<p><br></p><strong>Job Posting</strong><p><br></p>May 22, 2023, 9:28:23 AM<p><br></p><strong>Unposting Date</strong><p><br></p>Jun 13, 2023, 12:59:00 AM

title: Azure Data Engineer / DBA
description: We're looking for a Data Engineer/Azure DBA to join a leading financial services company dedicated to providing solutions to their clients. In this role you'll specialize in Azure SQL DB/Azure Managed Instance, possess advanced proficiency with SQL Server 201x, and have a strong understanding of Data Lake/Data Lakehouse Environments. The ideal candidate will have practical experience with Azure Data Factory or other ETL toolsets, exposure to Kafka/Azure Event Hub/Other Event Sourcing toolsets, and familiarity with MDM. Exceptional communication and collaboration skills are essential for this role. In this role, you will play a vital role in supporting new business relationships, launching consumer products, and contributing to the organization's data platforms. If you are ready to make an impact and be part of a team that is revolutionizing how businesses thrive, apply now and join us on this exciting journey. Required Skills &amp; Experience Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, computer engineering, or a related field, or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Extensive experience with Microsoft SQL Server 201x, Azure SQL DB, Azure Managed Instance, and general Azure environment management. Expertise in relational and dimensional database modeling, data development, and administration. Extensive experience with ETL/ELT pipelines, including tools such as SSIS, Azure Data Factory, Function Apps, Logic Apps, etc. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent written and oral communication skills. Desired Skills &amp; Experience Exposure to or experience with data mesh and event streaming. Practical experience with structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data. Practical experience with the Azure data development stack. Practical experience with Visual Studio, Azure DevOps, Git. Practical experience with data privacy practices and regulations, particularly in highly regulated industries. The Offer Bonus OR Commission eligible You will receive the following benefits: Medical Insurance Dental Benefits Vision Benefits Paid Time Off (PTO) 401(k) {including match- if applicable} Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the US on a full-time basis now and in the future.<p><br></p>Azure Data Engineer / DBA<p><br></p>

The ideal candidate will have practical experience with Azure Data Factory or other ETL toolsets, exposure to Kafka/Azure Event Hub/Other Event Sourcing toolsets, and familiarity with MDM. Exceptional communication and collaboration skills are essential for this role. In this role, you will play a vital role in supporting new business relationships, launching consumer products, and contributing to the organization's data platforms. If you are ready to make an impact and be part of a team that is revolutionizing how businesses thrive, apply now and join us on this exciting journey. Required Skills &amp; Experience Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, computer engineering, or a related field, or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Extensive experience with Microsoft SQL Server 201x, Azure SQL DB, Azure Managed Instance, and general Azure environment management. Expertise in relational and dimensional database modeling, data development, and administration. Extensive experience with ETL/ELT pipelines, including tools such as SSIS, Azure Data Factory, Function Apps, Logic Apps, etc. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent written and oral communication skills. Desired Skills &amp; Experience Exposure to or experience with data mesh and event streaming. Practical experience with structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data. Practical experience with the Azure data development stack. Practical experience with Visual Studio, Azure DevOps, Git. Practical experience with data privacy practices and regulations, particularly in highly regulated industries. The Offer Bonus OR Commission eligible You will receive the following benefits: Medical Insurance Dental Benefits Vision Benefits Paid Time Off (PTO) 401(k) {including match- if applicable} Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the US on a full-time basis now and in the future.<p><br></p>Azure Data Engineer / DBA<p><br></p>

title: Service Engineer
description: <strong><strong>Job Req ID: 22360</strong></strong><p><br></p><strong><u>About Supermicro</u></strong><p><br></p>Supermicro® is a Top Tier provider of advanced server, storage, and networking solutions for Data Center, Cloud Computing, Enterprise IT, Hadoop/ Big Data, Hyperscale, HPC and IoT/Embedded customers worldwide. We are the #5 fastest growing company among the Silicon Valley Top 50 technology firms. Our unprecedented global expansion has provided us with the opportunity to offer a large number of new positions to the technology community. We seek talented, passionate, and committed engineers, technologists, and business leaders to join us.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>This is a full-time remote position at West Chicago, IL working with the Supermicro Global Service Team. Supermicro is seeking a Service Engineer that will be responsible for field work at customer sites to resolve and repair server systems. The Service Engineer is a critical part of post-sales support and needs to demonstrate exceptional technical aptitude in working with server products in addition to excellent interpersonal skills. It requires the ability to Support our Global Service network and help build a world-class field service organization.<p><br></p><strong><u>Essential Duties And Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Includes the following essential duties and responsibilities (other duties may also be assigned):</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> On-site and remote troubleshooting and resolving complex technical problems on Supermicro equipment in an enterprise environment</li><li> Drive customer satisfaction through service excellence by leading preventive maintenance actions, managing repair/parts cycle times</li><li> Ensure escalation situations are managed and corrected quickly and professionally</li><li> Provide 2nd line support to the reseller / distributors in all aspects of customer support</li><li> Have a very high level of enterprise solution product knowledge</li><li> Work with Technical Account Manager, Service Manager, and Product Manager to define service programs</li><li> Provide and contribute information such as fault triage and training materials</li><li> Run tests and simulations at our facility to assist with problem solving</li><li> Travel to the field to train and or resolve customer issues</li><li> Train new service engineers</li><li> Able to work under Technical Account Manager direction and take ownership of customer base</li><li> Demonstrate ability to be self-sufficient in the field</li><li> Able to defuse challenging situations</li><li> Manage time effectively; prioritize and make good business judgments and decisions in relationship to efficiency, effectiveness while meeting daily service expectations</li><li> Determines requirements and/or root cause of technical issues by working with customers</li><li> Resolves problems by clarifying issues; researching and exploring answers and alternative solutions; implementing solutions; escalating unresolved problems</li><li> Ability to produce meaningful report and metrices is a plus</li><li> Ability to work flexible hours and/or flexible shifts including weekends and holidays if needed</li><li> Travel is required (up to 25%)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent work experience preferred</li><li> Minimum of 3 years’ experience in field support servicing complex X86 systems and parts preferred</li><li> Will consider Associates Degree in electrical technology, electronics, or equivalent military experience</li><li> Work experience in large enterprise or certification in Windows and Linux environment is a plus</li><li> Emphasize break/fix experience and on-site customer service experience</li><li> Hands on experience with servers (Supermicro, EMC, DELL, HP)</li><li> Solid hardware system diagnostics skills, as well as a good understanding of how BIOS, drivers, and application loads can cause system issues</li><li> Strong technical communication skills to lead investigations with engineers of multiple disciplines</li><li> Strong written and verbal communication skills, project management skills, solid time management skills</li><li> Be able to participate in multiple cross-functional projects concurrently in a rapidly changing environment, within established timelines and have a demonstrated ability to learn and embrace new and changing technologies</li><li> Ability to work in a challenging, dynamic, and fast-paced environment with the ability to identify and escalate issues in a timely manner, and be proactive in driving solutions</li><li> Full professional proficiency in English (read/write/speak)</li><li> Familiarity with Linux is a plus</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><strong>Salary Range</strong></strong><p><br></p>$60,000 - $110,000<p><br></p>The salary offered will depend on several factors, including your location, level, education, training, specific skills, years of experience, and comparison to other employees already in this role. In addition to a comprehensive benefits package, candidates may be eligible for other forms of compensation, such as participation in bonus and equity award programs.<p><br></p><strong><strong>EEO Statement</strong></strong><p><br></p>Supermicro is an Equal Opportunity Employer and embraces diversity in our employee population. It is the policy of Supermicro to provide equal opportunity to all qualified applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status or special disabled veteran, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.

title: Kafka Cloud Engineer
description: *We are unable to sponsor for this permanent Full time role*<p><br></p>*Position is bonus eligible*<p><br></p>Prestigious Global Firm is currently seeking a Kafka Cloud Engineer. Candidate will perform a range of activities required to both maintain and continuously automate a large, complex virtualization and cloud-based computing environment. In addition, you will provide technical guidance within the team on kafka and when called upon, serve as a technical liaison between internal departments. This will involve utilizing best practices for the management, architecture, configuration, DR, administration, and automation of the enterprise server virtualization environment with cloud technologies.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Provide professional input to the organization for cloud and virtualization end-to-end architecture and IaaS, as well as PaaS and SaaS solutions such as AWS RedShift</li><li>Develop and maintain a library of deployable, tested, and documented automation design scripts, processes, and procedures</li><li>Enable DevOps development activities and complex development tasks that will involve working with tools such as Docker, Kafka and container management systems</li><li>Provide advanced Kafka administrative support</li><li>Design, configure, implement and support an automated workflow for cloud and virtual environment provisioning, with a particular focus on Kafka clusters.</li><li>Implement production changes during defined maintenance windows and support on call rotation</li><li>Perform cloud computing and virtual environment build-outs, software installation, maintenance and support</li><li>Write and maintain documentation of relevant operating procedures and processes</li><li>Design, develop, and build the business's cloud infrastructure architecture</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Strong experience with Confluent's Kafka Products and Platforms</li><li>[Working knowledge of infrastructure design and components, such as: Servers, operating systems, networks, and storage (basic) and (advanced) knowledge of Confluent Kafka.</li><li>Experience with architecting, implementing and maintaining highly available mission critical environments for 24/7 availability</li><li>Experience working in an environment with a defined production change control process</li><li>[Demonstrates history of working within deadlines and ability to work well under pressure</li><li>Strong hands-on experience Scripting/development skills in Python, Ruby, Go, Java, JavaScript, etc. in a corporate environment </li><li>Hands-on experience with: Terraform, Kubernetes, Jenkins, Kafka, Github, OpenShift, and configuration management tools such as Ansible.</li><li>Relevant experience with configuration and implementation of IaaS, Infrastructure as code, AWS.</li><li>AWS Solutions Architect Associate Certification or higher strongly desired</li><li>Relevant industry certifications such as Confluent Certified Administrator for Apache Kafka</li><li>Certificates or Licenses:</li><li>Bachelor's degree, preferably in a technical discipline (Computer Science, Mathematics, etc.), or equivalent combination of education and experience required</li><li>3+ years experience in IT systems installation, operations, administration, and maintenance of virtualized Servers/cloud systems and Kafka systems.</li></ul>

title: Onyx Cloud Engineer
description: <strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p>The Onyx Cloud Engineer will be a subject matter/domain expert with specific expertise with AWS at a minimum, requisite for the position to that of a DevOps/GitOps Cloud Engineer, in a hands-on capacity, with working knowledge and understanding centered around the following areas:<p><br></p>" GitOps, DevOps, and ChatOps principles and best practices<p><br></p>" AWS managed services, included but not limited to EKS, ECR, RDS, KMS, IAM,VPC, Lambda, Route 53, ALB, ELB, Dynamo DB, EC2, S3, SNS, SQS, EBS, Transit Gateway, Direct Connect, network access control list, and security groups<p><br></p>" Kubernetes (EKS preferred)<p><br></p>" Helm Charts/Helm Files<p><br></p>" IaC (Terraform)<p><br></p>" IDP (Azure AD*)<p><br></p>" SEIM<p><br></p>" Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment, Continuous Delivery concepts and supporting commercial and OSS tooling, including but not limited Jenkins, Jfrog Artifactory &amp; Xray, SonarQube, Harness*, Spinnaker*, and ArgoCD*<p><br></p>" Pipeline as Code<p><br></p>" Continuous Observability specific to logging, monitoring, and tracing leveraging OSS tooling such as: Splunk, Dynatrace, Prometheus, Grafana, Fluentd, Kuberhealthy*, and Open Telemetry* as well as AWS managed services such as CloudWatch<p><br></p><strong><u>Skills</u></strong><p><br></p>Aws, kubernetes, terraform, Cloud, splunk, dynatrace, kuberhealthy, open telemetry<p><br></p><strong><u>Top Skills Details</u></strong><p><br></p>Aws, kubernetes, terraform, Cloud<p><br></p><strong><u>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p>" Defines the set of declarative modules for infrastructure provisioning via Terraform Enterprise for the design, build, and implementation of the Onyx Cloud Platform, hosted on AWS<p><br></p>" Drives industry best practices and approaches to implementing infrastructure as code (IaC) specific to Kubernetes infrastructure provisioning<p><br></p>" Actively engages and participates in both internal and external technology forums related to Terraform, Kubernetes and DevOps/GitOps initiatives<p><br></p>" Provides sound recommendations in order to improve and/or implement best practices for supporting Onyx Toolchain strategy and initiatives<p><br></p>" Hands-on keyboard coding required<p><br></p><strong><u>About Us</u></strong><p><br></p>Skiltrek is an award-winning IT staffing firm and the staffing partner of choice for many leading companies across the US.<p><br></p>At Skiltrek, we promise you the perfect opportunity of building technical excellence, understand business performance and nuances,<p><br></p>be abreast with the latest happenings in technology world and enjoy a satisfying work life balance.<p><br></p>Skiltrek is committed to equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to gender,<p><br></p>race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law.<p><br></p>Skiltrek is an equal opportunity employer; committed to a community of inclusion, and an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

Manager to define service programs</li><li> Provide and contribute information such as fault triage and training materials</li><li> Run tests and simulations at our facility to assist with problem solving</li><li> Travel to the field to train and or resolve customer issues</li><li> Train new service engineers</li><li> Able to work under Technical Account Manager direction and take ownership of customer base</li><li> Demonstrate ability to be self-sufficient in the field</li><li> Able to defuse challenging situations</li><li> Manage time effectively; prioritize and make good business judgments and decisions in relationship to efficiency, effectiveness while meeting daily service expectations</li><li> Determines requirements and/or root cause of technical issues by working with customers</li><li> Resolves problems by clarifying issues; researching and exploring answers and alternative solutions; implementing solutions; escalating unresolved problems</li><li> Ability to produce meaningful report and metrices is a plus</li><li> Ability to work flexible hours and/or flexible shifts including weekends and holidays if needed</li><li> Travel is required (up to 25%)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent work experience preferred</li><li> Minimum of 3 years’ experience in field support servicing complex X86 systems and parts preferred</li><li> Will consider Associates Degree in electrical technology, electronics, or equivalent military experience</li><li> Work experience in large enterprise or certification in Windows and Linux environment is a plus</li><li> Emphasize break/fix experience and on-site customer service experience</li><li> Hands on experience with servers (Supermicro, EMC, DELL, HP)</li><li> Solid hardware system diagnostics skills, as well as a good understanding of how BIOS, drivers, and application loads can cause system issues</li><li> Strong technical communication skills to lead investigations with engineers of multiple disciplines</li><li> Strong written and verbal communication skills, project management skills, solid time management skills</li><li> Be able to participate in multiple cross-functional projects concurrently in a rapidly changing environment, within established timelines and have a demonstrated ability to learn and embrace new and changing technologies</li><li> Ability to work in a challenging, dynamic, and fast-paced environment with the ability to identify and escalate issues in a timely manner, and be proactive in driving solutions</li><li> Full professional proficiency in English (read/write/speak)</li><li> Familiarity with Linux is a plus</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><strong>Salary Range</strong></strong><p><br></p>$60,000 - $110,000<p><br></p>The salary offered will depend on several factors, including your location, level, education, training, specific skills, years of experience, and comparison to other employees already in this role. In addition to a comprehensive benefits package, candidates may be eligible for other forms of compensation, such as participation in bonus and equity award programs.<p><br></p><strong><strong>EEO Statement</strong></strong><p><br></p>Supermicro is an Equal Opportunity Employer and embraces diversity in our employee population. It is the policy of Supermicro to provide equal opportunity to all qualified applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status or special disabled veteran, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.

title: Kafka Cloud Engineer
description: *We are unable to sponsor for this permanent Full time role*<p><br></p>*Position is bonus eligible*<p><br></p>Prestigious Global Firm is currently seeking a Kafka Cloud Engineer. Candidate will perform a range of activities required to both maintain and continuously automate a large, complex virtualization and cloud-based computing environment. In addition, you will provide technical guidance within the team on kafka and when called upon, serve as a technical liaison between internal departments. This will involve utilizing best practices for the management, architecture, configuration, DR, administration, and automation of the enterprise server virtualization environment with cloud technologies.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Provide professional input to the organization for cloud and virtualization end-to-end architecture and IaaS, as well as PaaS and SaaS solutions such as AWS RedShift</li><li>Develop and maintain a library of deployable, tested, and documented automation design scripts, processes, and procedures</li><li>Enable DevOps development activities and complex development tasks that will involve working with tools such as Docker, Kafka and container management systems</li><li>Provide advanced Kafka administrative support</li><li>Design, configure, implement and support an automated workflow for cloud and virtual environment provisioning, with a particular focus on Kafka clusters.</li><li>Implement production changes during defined maintenance windows and support on call rotation</li><li>Perform cloud computing and virtual environment build-outs, software installation, maintenance and support</li><li>Write and maintain documentation of relevant operating procedures and processes</li><li>Design, develop, and build the business's cloud infrastructure architecture</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Strong experience with Confluent's Kafka Products and Platforms</li><li>[Working knowledge of infrastructure design and components, such as: Servers, operating systems, networks, and storage (basic) and (advanced) knowledge of Confluent Kafka.</li><li>Experience with architecting, implementing and maintaining highly available mission critical environments for 24/7 availability</li><li>Experience working in an environment with a defined production change control process</li><li>[Demonstrates history of working within deadlines and ability to work well under pressure</li><li>Strong hands-on experience Scripting/development skills in Python, Ruby, Go, Java, JavaScript, etc. in a corporate environment </li><li>Hands-on experience with: Terraform, Kubernetes, Jenkins, Kafka, Github, OpenShift, and configuration management tools such as Ansible.</li><li>Relevant experience with configuration and implementation of IaaS, Infrastructure as code, AWS.</li><li>AWS Solutions Architect Associate Certification or higher strongly desired</li><li>Relevant industry certifications such as Confluent Certified Administrator for Apache Kafka</li><li>Certificates or Licenses:</li><li>Bachelor's degree, preferably in a technical discipline (Computer Science, Mathematics, etc.), or equivalent combination of education and experience required</li><li>3+ years experience in IT systems installation, operations, administration, and maintenance of virtualized Servers/cloud systems and Kafka systems.</li></ul>

title: Test Engineer
description: <strong><u>Company Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>Sterling Site Access Solutions LLC is a national vertically integrated site access service provider to the North American Energy Infrastructure Marketplace. An Illinois based company, with facilities located across the country, including regional construction offices, distribution centers and world class manufacturing facilities. As a data driven company, Sterling provides complete turnkey ground protection products and services to the transmission &amp; distribution, renewables, civil and oil &amp; gas markets. Sterling is committed to developing our employees, providing best in class customer service and being responsible stewards of the environment.<p><br></p><strong><u>Position Overview</u></strong><p><br></p>The R&amp;D Test Engineer must be task-oriented, extremely adaptable and possess exceptional, out-of-the-box problem solving ability. This position will lead critical R&amp;D projects through the testing and validation process.<p><br></p><strong><u>Essential Functions &amp; Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Consistently demonstrate commitment and support for the Sterling Vision and Mission, policies, and procedures.</li><li>Pursue Continuous Improvement activities to ensure efficiency and effectiveness within area of responsibility.</li><li>Assume other responsibilities and complete tasks as assigned to meet the on-going needs of the organization.</li><li>Represent company in technical organizations, trade shows and sales demos. </li><li>Manage all phases of the Product Development Stage-Gate Process including:</li></ul> <u> Discovery </u><p><br></p><ul><li>Research and suggest new materials, methods and approaches based upon team objectives. </li><li>Assess high-level business case and feasibility.</li></ul> <u> Scope </u><p><br></p><ul><li>Identify necessary technical requirements, restraints, specifications &amp; certifications.</li><li>Create and manage project timeline.</li></ul> <u> Development </u><p><br></p><ul><li>Engineer solutions, produce prototypes, obtain samples.</li><li>Develop testing procedures, processes and standards. </li><li>Train team and external resources to perform testing . </li><li>Determine sourcing, tooling, cost monitoring and test plan.</li></ul> <u> Testing / Validation </u><p><br></p><ul><li>Execute test plans, manage field studies and validate certification actions.</li><li>Process data and analyze results.</li><li>Iterate through scope, development and testing phases until project outcomes are confirmed.</li></ul> <strong> EDUCATION, TRAINING, CERTIFICATIONS &amp; EXPERIENCE</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Preferred - Bachelor of Science in Wood, Engineering, Data and Analytics, Materials or similar </li><li>Extensive lab testing, testing design and data analysis experience </li><li>Minimum 5 years' experience in wood science or advanced degree </li></ul> <strong> SKILLS &amp; KNOWLEDGE</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Subject matter expertise in materials, testing design, testing procedures and testing management, etc. </li><li>Character consistent with the Sterling Values and Business Code of Conduct &amp; Ethics. </li><li>Portray a consistent, positive and winning attitude with a team mindset. </li><li>Self-starter, ability to handle criticism, flexible, works well with limited direction. </li><li>Project management expertise and demonstratable experience </li><li>Expertise in data aggregation, analysis, and presentation </li><li>Proven leadership and collaboration skills with the ability to effectively supervise, coach, and influence employees, vendors and service providers. </li><li>Strong analytical skills to analyze complex business processes and identify risk in high visibility, and high stress situations; quickly and accurately apply sound, well-balanced reasoning to each decision. </li><li>Ability to identify opportunities to increase accuracy, optimize resources and implement solutions. </li><li>Strong time and project management skills with ability to multitask and prioritize workloads. </li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills; able to present clean, organized and thorough information and data appropriate for intended audience. </li><li>Experience or trainable in forklift operation, wood working equipment and hand tools. </li><li>Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), MS Project, LabVIEW, MatLab, CAD software Project Management Software; ability to learn and achieve proficiency in new software applications. </li></ul> <strong> ACKNOWLEDGEMENT: </strong> This job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to the role.

title: Software Engineer
description: <strong>Description</strong><p><br></p><strong>Company Description:</strong><p><br></p>Apexon is a digital-first technology services firm backed by Goldman Sachs Asset Management and Everstone Capital. We specialize in accelerating business transformation and delivering human-centric digital experiences. For over 17 years, Apexon has been meeting customers wherever they are in the digital lifecycle and helping them outperform their competition through speed and innovation.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities And Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Manage multiple tasks and use sound judgment when prioritizing.</li><li>Collaborate with global cross functional teams in building customer-centric products.</li><li>Analyze existing software implementations to identify areas of improvement and provide deadline estimates for implementing new features.</li><li>Update and maintain documentation for team processes, best practices and software runbooks.</li><li>Establish trusted partnerships with peers, product heads, and executive level stakeholders.</li><li>Must be passionate about technology and engineering.</li><li>Exceptional analytical skills and ability to apply knowledge and experience in decision-making.</li><li>Ability to leverage technology to deliver business value.</li><li>Must be independent and comfortable in a fast paced, ambiguous and often multi-directional work environment.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Skills And Experience We Are Looking For</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum 5 years of relevant professional experience using a modern programming language (preferably Java/Scala).</li><li>Experience with Databases (SQL or no-SQL)</li><li>B.S. or higher in Computer Science (or equivalent work experience).</li><li>Strong analytical skills.</li><li>Experience leveraging test-driven development methodologies.</li><li>Comfort with Agile operating models (practical experience of Scrum/Kanban)</li><li>Team oriented; strong interpersonal and communication skills.</li><li> Energetic, self-directed, and self-motivated</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Disclaimer</strong><p><br></p>If you feel that this is a good match for your skillsets, please submit a current word version of your resume along with a cover letter describing your skills, experience and salary expectations. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). You can read our job applicant privacy policy here .

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: <strong>Job#: 1349918<br><br></strong><strong>Job Description:<br><br></strong><strong>Infrastructure Engineer<br><br></strong>REMOTE<br><br>Apex Systems, the Nation’s 2nd largest Technical Staffing and Services Firm, has an opening for an Infrastructure Engineer for a Large Mobile Network Operator company in Chicago for a 11-month contract plus extensions.<br><br>Please email resume in WORD format to Ly, <strong> [email protected] <br><br></strong><u><strong>Role Specific Responsibilities<br></strong></u><ul><li>Identify changes needed in the infrastructure configuration to achieve the technology organization goals</li><li>Define aggregate demand data in support of budget plans and make recommendations for ways to improve performance and / reduce costs</li><li>Supports the infrastructure strategy reviews and development by performing applicable analysis</li><li>Provide project management oversight to infrastructure implementation projects.</li><li>Implements technology and infrastructure changes for platforms, performance and scoring.</li><li>Analyzes system response and determines tuning recommendations to improve performance.</li><li>Lead effective issue identification and resolution process; serve as the focal point for infrastructure-related issue / crisis resolution</li><li>See opportunities to save costs and more effectively handle assets</li><li>Ensure communication of process and procedure changes to key stakeholders</li><li>Design an effective test plan for any new / changed infrastructure technology and work with Project Managers, QA / Testing</li><li>Managers and Release Managers to ensure its implementation before the client takes possession of the system</li><li>Support identification and collection of metrics and performance reporting processes</li><li>Monitors delivery against SLAs and reports exceptions to management</li><li>Participate in process improvement initiatives, when applicable</li><li>Business Partnership</li><li>Maintain contact with the business users to proactively identify needed changes</li><li>Establish working relationships with technical, business and sourcing counterparts</li><li>Participate in process improvement initiatives</li><li>People Management</li><li>Handle individual workload and deliver to agreed upon milestones</li><li>Proactively promote consistent project-based performance measurement and skill development of junior staff</li><li>Actively participate in HR performance measurement processes</li><li>Demonstrate ability to work in team environment and help resolve issues</li><li>Provide input to staffing plans at the project-level to identify key / required skills<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>College degree in related technical / business areas or equivalent work experience</li><li>Understanding of the technology organization and / or business and technology</li><li>Re-engineering / process improvement experience, leading and coaching quality improvement projects</li><li>Strong change management skills; change agent</li><li>Excellent problem solving / analytical skills and knowledge of analytical tools</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Ability to create / define metrics that accurately reflects the current state of a given process</li><li>Knowledge of Six Sigma, CMM and other relevant methodologies<br><br></li></ul>EEO Employer<br><br>Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. change agent</li><li>Excellent problem solving / analytical skills and knowledge of analytical tools</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Ability to create / define metrics that accurately reflects the current state of a given process</li><li>Knowledge of Six Sigma, CMM and other relevant methodologies<br><br></li></ul>EEO Employer<br><br>Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. title: Software Engineer - Tanzu Application Platform on Public Cloud - Opportunity for Working Remotely
description: The Elevator Pitch: Why will you enjoy this new opportunity?<p><br></p>Tanzu Application Platform (TAP) is VMware’s multi-cloud application platform built on top of Kubernetes. With it, developers and operators can build and manage their Kubernetes infrastructure, packages, and cloud workloads quickly and securely with a rich set of developer tooling. You will be integrated into the TAP on Public Clouds team where you'll get to work with cutting-edge cloud-native tooling and become an advocate for first-class integrations of TAP with public cloud providers.<p><br></p>This is a unique opportunity to look more broadly at the TAP user experience to design and drive deeper integrations with native cloud provider services. Coupling the superior developer experience delivered via TAP with the scale and services of public clouds is strategically important and has the potential for a multiplicative effect on the value of TAP in the market.<p><br></p>This team - and VMware - recognize that every individual brings with them a unique set of knowledge, experiences, and potential. Our team offers an environment that is flexible and nurturing while helping each other hone our engineering craft.<p><br></p>What is the primary need, technical challenge, and/or problem you will be responsible for?<p><br></p>In this role, you will work to make TAP the preferred application platform across cloud providers. Tactically, our team is approaching this by enabling the easy deployment and consumption of TAP by integrating with public cloud marketplaces, and further identifying and integrating with cloud provider services customers would like to leverage via TAP. An example of this would be providing deep integration of TAP with Amazon Elastic Container Registry (ECR), ensuring that TAP fully integrates with it from an auth, security, and networking perspective.<p><br></p>Success in the Role: What are the performance goals over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing?<p><br></p>Success in this role means you are establishing rapport with team members, participating in and honing the software delivery lifecycle process to ensure that we are focused on iteratively increasing the impact we have on consumption of TAP on the public cloud. In the first 6 months, you have made TAP easier to consume on public clouds by implementing a process for deploying infrastructure and installing TAP on all major cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP). In 12 months you have made the TAP experience better by enabling the consumption of native cloud provider services via tight integration with TAP. The further we integrate with cloud services, the more we will drive consumption of TAP on these providers<p><br></p>What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing regularly?<p><br></p><ul><li>Drive cross-team technical tasks by building relationships across the product portfolio.</li><li>2 years or more of industry software development experience with enterprise software and/or cloud systems at scale.</li><li>Research and develop cutting edge cloud native software.</li><li>Proficiency in operations and software development with at least one cloud provider (AWS, Azure, or GCP) or an aptitude to pursue deep knowledge in one of these providers.</li><li>Provide feedback and coaching of peers through code and design reviews.</li><li>An advocate for agile software development methodologies.</li><li>Write tests, tools, automation, and documentation aligned with our roadmap.</li><li>Provide feedback throughout product management and engineering to improve Tanzu solutions’ user experience and highlight new areas of need.</li><li>Participate in customer briefings on technologies in the cloud native space providing insight and experience from Kubernetes users and VMware customers. </li><li>Maintain knowledge of platforms, architectures and the CNCF landscape with a deep understanding of Kubernetes and the Tanzu portfolio.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What is leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team like?</strong><p><br></p>The hiring manager for this role is Aaron Meza, Senior Engineering Manager, Tanzu Application Platform (TAP) on Public Clouds. Aaron is passionate about building diverse, human-focused delivery teams with an emphasis on deliberate development - a belief that focusing on individual growth is not just a win for individuals but a win for business and customer outcomes as well. Aaron is passionate about making complex systems accessible and simple.<p><br></p>The TAP on Public Clouds team is relatively new. It is made up of individuals with diverse backgrounds who are excited about leveraging native cloud services to make the TAP experience seamless on our customer's preferred cloud provider.<p><br></p>What are the benefits and perks of working at VMware?<p><br></p>You and your loved ones will be supported with a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Below are some highlights, or you can view the complete benefits package by visiting benefits.vmware.com.<p><br></p>Medical Coverage, Retirement, and Parental Leave Plans for All Family Types<p><br></p>Generous Time Off Programs<p><br></p>40 hours of paid time to volunteer in your community<p><br></p>Rethink's Neurodiversity program to support parents raising children with learning or behavior challenges, or developmental disabilities<p><br></p>Financial contributions to your ongoing development (conference participation, trainings, course work, etc.)<p><br></p>Wellness reimbursement and online fitness and wellbeing classes<p><br></p>This job may require the candidate to travel and/or work from a facility that requires full vaccination prior to entry.<p><br></p><strong>VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: </strong>VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at VMware are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. VMware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.<p><br></p>This job may require the candidate to travel and/or work from a facility that requires full vaccination prior to entry.<p><br></p><strong>Category : </strong>Engineering and Technology<p><br></p><strong>Subcategory: </strong>Software Engineering<p><br></p><strong>Experience: </strong>Manager and Professional<p><br></p><strong>Full Time/ Part Time: </strong>Full Time<p><br></p><strong>Posted Date:</strong> 2023-05-22<p><br></p>VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.<p><br></p>Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at VMware are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

title: Security Solutions Engineer
description: <strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong>As a DevOps Engineer, you will be a core, pivotal, and transformational member of the engineering team for our client. This role will be an integral part of our agile teams in analyzing, designing, building, and testing high quality cloud deployment methodologies and systems. You will work on a team under the leadership of senior architects, building the future of our state-of-the-art cloud-based platforms. This position will be fully responsible for our platform and application pipelines, and the flow of code updates through the engineering group, as well as creating and monitoring highly available cloud infrastructure and platforms to host that code. You will have the opportunity to work on a variety of technologies, especially cloud platform services.<br><br>Major responsibilities<br><br>Responsibilities will be diverse including cloud architecture and infrastructure, build tooling and dev-ops systems and processes.Responsibility will span all environments including production, development, and testing.<br><br><strong><u>Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li> Keen interpersonal skills with the ability to develop cohesive working relationships with internal and external clients.</li><li> Must be comfortable diving into large and complicated systems and quickly start making an impact</li><li> Display flexibility to adapt to change and willing to learn and develop new skill sets as applicable.</li><li> Skilled in technical writing and communication.</li><li> Must be able to collaborate with other developers/senior developers on ideas, workflows, and technologies</li><li> Experience planning and managing multiple deliverables in a highly energized and fast-paced environment.</li><li> Detail oriented, organized, and driven.</li><li> Skilled in technical, logical, analytical, and problem-solving<br></li></ul>Technology Doesn't Change the World, People Do.®<br><br>Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.<br><br>Robert Half puts you in the best position to succeed by advocating on your behalf and promoting you to employers. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity – even on the go.<br><br>All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Benefits are available to contract/temporary professionals, including medical, vision, dental, and life and disability insurance. Hired contract/temporary professionals are also eligible to enroll in our company 401(k) plan. Visit<br><br>© 2023 Robert Half. An Equal Opportunity Employer. M/F/Disability/Veterans. By clicking “Apply Now,” you’re agreeing to

title: DevOps Engineer
description: Top 3 Must Haves:<br><br>1.Minimum 5-6 Years of experience in React Native.<br>2.Hands on experience in react native bridge - IOS (Objective C/Swift) and Android (Kotlin/Java)<br>3.He / She should have good understanding on the following concepts like Redux, ES 6, JEST, ESLint<br><br>Roles/Responsibilities:<br><br>• Lead Developer will be working in cross-platform eCommerce mobile app development using React Native (IOS and Android)<br>• He / She will be handling third party dependency integration like Google Maps, Apple Pay etc., using react native bridge – IOS (Objective C/Swift) and Android (Kotlin/Java).<br>• The resource will work single handed, on very specific deliverables. He / She will be interacting directly with Client Tech Lead / Management team on regular basis.<br>• NFR gathering by reading documents and communicating with project team.<br>• Building the front end that focuses on the user interface (UI) and user experience (UX) of the mobile application.

title: Mobile Engineer
description: <ul><li>Description:* This company manufactures electronics and telematics offerings for the automotive/transportation industry.</li><li>Responsibilites:*</li><li>Quote, Design, and Develop manufacturing test solutions for New Product Introduction</li><li>Develop software (C#, C, and NI TestStand) to control test instruments and Units Under Test in order to meet product test requirements</li><li>Demonstrate the ability to develop hardware and software for production test solutions</li><li>Experience interpreting MySQL database schema and writing database queries</li><li>Provide ongoing support for existing products related to ECOs, yield issues, reliability improvements, and other continuous improvement initiatives</li><li>Written and verbal communication skills to effectively communicate with customers, suppliers, and internal project stakeholders</li><li>Manage project scopes and timelines and coordinate initiatives with Project Managers</li><li>Collaborate with Production Engineers and Supervisors to integrate test systems into the production process</li><li>Analyze test performance data and use production personnel input to drive test improvements opportunities</li><li>Ability to develop and interpret test requirements and identify test equipment required to meet those requirements</li><li>Ability to identify, assess, and resolve hardware and software issues</li><li>Compile and interpret Gage R&amp;R and Cpk studies</li><li>Support Root Cause Analysis of field return issues and implement additional test coverage as needed</li><li>Create documentation describing test design concepts and operator instructions</li><li>Experience related to manufacturing Printed Circuit Board Assemblies</li><li>Participate in peer reviews of test solutions</li><li>Skills:* Labview, C#, Test Stand, SQL, Manufacturing Test, Test Automation, Test development, Test design, Test procedure, Hardware, Debug, Test Fixture, Production, Manufacturing, Lab, Validation, Test plan, Test engineering, Electrical, Test equipment, Write test scripts</li><li>Top Skills Details:* Labview</li><li>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications:*</li><li>5+ years experience</li><li>Labview</li><li>Test Stand</li><li>C# or other Object oriented languages within test and instrumentation</li><li>Test fixtures/test stands;</li><li>SQL or MySQL PLUS</li><li>Automotive is a plus not required though.</li><li>Experience developing tests for RF or wireless devices (i.e. Cellular, GPS, Bluetooth, WiFi)</li><li>Experience Level:* Intermediate Level<br><br></li></ul>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Onyx Cloud Engineer
description: Title: Digital Reliability Analyst Location: Prefer someone local to Chicago Duration: Long TermManager Comments :Prefer someone local to Chicago.Description:OverviewUnited’s Digital technology team is looking for an experienced Usability/Accessibility tester to join our Digital Reliability team. As an Accessibility Tester at United, you will work collaboratively with our Agile/Scrum teams responsible for testing our digital products for compliance with accessibility standards, such as WCAG 2.0. You will also be responsible for writing and maintaining accessibility testing documentation, such as test plans, test cases, and bug reports. The ideal candidate will have experience with a variety of accessibility testing tools and methodologies (e.g., VoiceOver, JAWS, Dragon Naturally Speaking, ZoomText, TalkBack, Speak to Me, axe DevTools), as well as a strong understanding of accessibility standards and how they apply to web, mobile, and software applications.Job Description:<p><br></p><ul><li>Understand and apply accessibility guidelines (WCAG, Section 508, ADA, AODA) to United Digital products</li><li>Perform manual (an or automated) testing of digital products for compliance with accessibility standards</li><li>Be able to describe accessibility issues and recommendations for resolving same in bug reports to developers</li><li>Retest products after fixes have been implemented to ensure that issues have been properly addressed</li><li>Knowledge of the latest accessibility technologies and trends</li><li>Educate team members on accessibility best practices</li><li>Advocate for the inclusion of accessibility considerations in all phases of product development</li><li>Participate in usability testing to provide insights on how people with accessibility challenges use United products</li><li>Assist with the creation of accessibility-related documentation, such as policies, procedures, and user guides</li><li>Provide training and awareness sessions on accessibility topics to internal and external audiences</li><li>Design and write manual front-end test scripts for assigned workflows to validate design and configuration against defined requirements</li><li>Analyze, resolve, and report on testing status, gaps, and issues to leadership during various testing cycles</li><li>Build collaborative relationships with internal and external project stakeholders to achieve business objectives related to testing activities, defect investigations, issues, and concerns related to assigned testing and products</li><li>Maintain testing documentation and artifacts for each test as proof of validation.Required Qualifications:Applicants for the Accessibility Tester role are required to have these qualifications:</li><li>Knowledge of digital accessibility and inclusion</li><li>Knowledge of regulations related to digital accessibility (e.g., Section 508, ADA, WCAG)</li><li>Experience using accessibility evaluation tools and frameworks</li><li>Experience using assistive technologies (e.g., VoiceOver, JAWS, Dragon Naturally Speaking, ZoomText, TalkBack, Speak to Me, axe DevTools)</li><li>5 + years of combined related work experience and completed higher educationand some level of Accessbility certificationPreferredApplicants with the following qualifications will be preferred:</li><li>Knowledge of web technologies (e.g., HTML, CSS, JavaScript and ARIA)</li><li>Professional training in using assistive technologies</li><li>Experience conducting usability tests that include participants with accessibility challenges</li><li>Has experience using assistive technology working on products or similar products</li><li>Experience using automation tools Digital Reliability Analyst // Chicago, IL</li></ul>

title: Test Engineer
description: <strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Our team is responsible for building out pages and applications for our Loyalty program<p><br></p>Candidate will be expected to contribute immediately building applications in React and Node JS. For visual problems, a combination of JavaScript and CSS, for backend services, mostly Node JS and some Java would be a plus.<p><br></p>Skiltrek is looking for a local candidate willing to come in at times during the week to collaborate with co-workers.<p><br></p><strong><u>Skills</u></strong><p><br></p>React, Node.js, React.js, Css, Javascript, Java nice to have<p><br></p><strong><u>About Us</u></strong><p><br></p>Skiltrek is an award-winning IT staffing firm and the staffing partner of choice for many leading companies across the US.<p><br></p>At Skiltrek, we promise you the perfect opportunity of building technical excellence, understand business performance and nuances,<p><br></p>be abreast with the latest happenings in technology world and enjoy a satisfying work life balance.<p><br></p>Skiltrek is committed to equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to gender,<p><br></p>race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law.<p><br></p>Skiltrek is an equal opportunity employer; committed to a community of inclusion, and an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

title: Digital Reliability Analyst // Chicago, IL
description: <strong>Job Title: Cloud Engineer</strong><p><br></p><strong>Location: Chicago, IL 60603 (3 days onsite)</strong><p><br></p><strong>Contract To Hire<br><br>W2 Only<br><br></strong><strong>The Cloud Engineer will be a subject matter/domain expert with specific expertise with AWS at a minimum, requisite for the position to that of a DevOps/GitOps Cloud Engineer, in a hands-on capacity, with working knowledge and understanding centered around the following areas:<br></strong><ul><li>GitOps, DevOps, and ChatOps principles and best practices</li><li>AWS managed services, included but not limited to EKS, ECR, RDS, KMS, IAM,VPC, Lambda, Route 53, ALB, ELB, Dynamo DB, EC2, S3, SNS, SQS, EBS, Transit Gateway, Direct Connect, network access control list, and security groups</li><li>Kubernetes (EKS preferred)</li><li>Helm Charts/Helm Files</li><li>IaC (Terraform)</li><li>IDP (Azure AD*)</li><li>SEIM</li><li>Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment, Continuous Delivery concepts and supporting commercial and OSS tooling, including but not limited Jenkins, Jfrog Artifactory &amp; Xray, SonarQube, Harness*, Spinnaker*, and ArgoCD*</li><li>Pipeline as Code</li><li>Continuous Observability specific to logging, monitoring, and tracing leveraging OSS tooling such as: Splunk, Dynatrace, Prometheus, Grafana, Fluentd, Kuberhealthy*, and Open Telemetry* as well as AWS managed services such as CloudWatch<br><br></li></ul><strong>Defines the set of declarative modules for infrastructure provisioning via Terraform Enterprise for the design, build, and implementation of the Onyx Cloud Platform, hosted on AWS<br></strong><ul><li>Drives industry best practices and approaches to implementing infrastructure as code (IaC) specific to Kubernetes infrastructure provisioning</li><li>Actively engages and participates in both internal and external technology forums related to Terraform, Kubernetes and DevOps/GitOps initiatives</li><li>Provides sound recommendations in order to improve and/or implement best practices for supporting Onyx Toolchain strategy and initiatives</li><li>Hands-on keyboard coding required<br><br></li></ul><strong>Pay Range: $72 - $75 W2<br><br></strong><em>The specific compensation for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role as well as the cost of labor in the market; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. Our full-time consultants have access to benefits including medical, dental, vision as well as 401K contributions.</em>

title: Software Engineer - Frontend
description: <strong>Summary<br><br></strong>This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and Web Services at scale. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.<br><br>Bring your Python and Golang skills to bear on identity, authorization and access management across Canonical's suite of enterprise products and web services.<br><br>As a software engineer for Identity Management products of Canonical, you will modernize and expand the capabilities of the identity management solutions we use for authentication and authorization in our products, as well as our canonical.com and ubuntu.com websites. Your work on Identity Management will directly impact the users of all Canonical products.<br><br>Technical excellence and a background in software engineering are necessary prerequisites for this role. You will be expected to own the design and delivery of the system, facilitate integrations and work with your team on strategy and execution.<br><br>What you'll do<br><ul><li>Collaborate proactively with a distributed team</li><li>Write clean web service APIs to support both CLI and web frontend clients, using Python (and optionally Golang). </li><li>Design and implement new features and enhancements from spec to production and ongoing operations at scale. </li><li>Review code produced by other engineers</li><li>Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions. </li><li>Create and enhance management, authentication and authorization API endpoints</li><li>Craft end-user authentication flows from design to implementation</li><li>Modernize the identity stack of our websites and products by driving adoption of best-of-breed IAM technologies </li><li>Deliver great products that users love by maintaining a culture of quality and engineering excellence</li><li>Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks per year for internal and external events<br><br></li></ul>Who you are<br><ul><li>You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree</li><li>You are a software engineer, with specific experience building identity and access management products </li><li>You are familiar with the open source software, standards, protocols and concepts in the identity space (e.g. OpenID, OAuth, LDAP)</li><li>You have experience implementing authorization frameworks in distributed systems</li><li>You value secure coding and standards, and enjoy working on teams that do the same</li><li>You have solid experience working in an agile development environment</li><li>You love technology and working with a diverse set of talented people. </li><li>You are comfortable with Ubuntu as a development and deployment platform. </li><li>You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable</li><li>You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated</li><li>You love embracing new technologies and pushing the boundaries of what is possible, with a view to building products that improve how people operate software and infrastructure everywhere <br><br></li></ul><strong>About Canonical<br><br></strong>Canonical is a growing, international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu -- the world's #1 cloud operating system. Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu. Canonical is a unique tech company - global, remote-first, open source, with 700 professionals across 50 countries - we want to be the world's best, not biggest, global software company. With almost every team remote by default, Canonical sets the pace on the 21st-century digital workplace.<br><br>What Canonical offers:<br><ul><li>Work from home</li><li>Learning and development allowances</li><li>Competitive Salary</li><li>Annual compensation review</li><li>Recognition rewards</li><li>Generous annual leave</li><li>Paid maternity, paternity and sick leave</li><li>Priority Pass for travel</li><li>Exposure to international business and technology<br><br></li></ul><em>We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.<br><br></em>#stack<br><br>

title: Sr Developer
description: <p><strong>Description</strong></p><p><br></p><p><span>We have a fairly urgent need for an Android (Kotlin) experienced developer.&nbsp;They have to have a minimum of 5 years experience in Android development&nbsp;Our first location preference will be Chicago and the second preference will be Houston and the 3rd preference will be visiting either Chicago/Houston office on his cost.</span></p><p><br></p><p><strong>Qualifications - External</strong></p><ul><li><strong>Required</strong><span>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Information Technology, related field or related experience</span></li><li><span>5+ years of professional development experience and knowledge in Android (Kotlin&nbsp;preferred)</span></li><li>5+ years of experience in design patterns and enterprise standards in application design</li><li><span>Exceptional at coding and on time delivery of quality components and or applications</span></li><li><span>Exceptional at component and unit testing of following standard practices and methodologies</span></li><li><span>Exceptional utilizing the technologies and domain knowledge with the delivery of developed components or integrated components</span></li><li>Exceptional at working problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires review of a variety of factors</li><li><span>Ability to work in Central Time Zone (CST) or Eastern Time Zone (EST)</span></li><li><strong>Preferred</strong><span>5+ years of experience and knowledge in iOS development (Swift/SwiftUI/UIKit).</span></li><li><span>Familiarity of full stack development</span></li><li><span>Familiarity of networking concepts and</span></li><li><span>Familiarity with code repositories like TFS,&nbsp;GitHub</span></li><li>Experience in the Airline Industry is a PLUS</li></ul><p><br></p>

title: Onyx Cloud Engineer (AWS)
description: This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, Python, and web services at scale. We are building the next generation management solution for Ubuntu in the enterprise - on premise and on the public cloud - to enable large estate observability, telemetry, security, compliance and operations. Build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.<br><br>Landscape is the leading management tool to deploy, monitor and manage fleets of Ubuntu systems, including package and repository management, health and security monitoring, hardware inventory, and automation. As Landscape software engineer you will be responsible for contributing on a distributed development team participating in all facets of the development process.<br><br>What you'll do<br><ul><li>Collaborate proactively with a distributed team</li><li>Write high-quality code to create new features, fix bugs and modernize the Landscape codebase</li><li>Demonstrate your strong commitment to code quality and automated testing</li><li>Participate in the engineering process with code and architectural reviews</li><li>Take personal ownership of problems and design and deliver solutions</li><li>Work remotely with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events</li><li>Assist with release management during each development cycle</li><li>Collaborate with devops for Landscape SaaS, Canonical's hosted Landscape<br><br></li></ul>Who you are<br><ul><li>You love technology and working with brilliant people</li><li>You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable</li><li>You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated</li><li>You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree</li><li>You have proficiency developing public-facing APIs and web applications, preferably using Python. </li><li>Experience with Python and web frameworks such as Flask and Django. </li><li>Experience with databases, and ORMs (PostgreSQL a plus)</li><li>You are comfortable with Ubuntu as a development and deployment platform. <br><br></li></ul><em>Canonical is proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We truly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better platform for our users and customers. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of the world of Ubuntu.<br><br></em>#stack<br><br>

title: Software Engineer - Identity Management for Canonical Products
description: <ul><li>Provide hands-on technical development, programming, and support to Pre-Clinical Toxicology group for development of web-based platforms/tools/databases using Microsoft Power Apps, SharePoint and others.</li><li>Mainly, we want someone who can help design and program per our requirements or specifications, the key point is that they will be doing the programming versus just consulting.</li><li>Looking for short term contractor to develop a power app for managing projects/programs/workload and work requisition tool.</li><li>There is another site/group using something similar.</li><li>We can show them what we are trying to do and need someone who can understand if we can take the current app and reconfigure for our needs, or if it will need to be built from the ground up.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Additional Info</u></strong><p><br></p>At FastTek Global, <strong>Our Purpose</strong> is <strong>Our People</strong> and <strong> Our Planet</strong> . We come to work each day and are reminded we are <strong><em>helping people find their success stories</em></strong> . Also, <strong><em>Doing the right thing </em></strong> is our mantra. We act responsibly, give back to the communities we serve and have a little fun along the way.<p><br></p>We have been doing this with pride, dedication and plain, old-fashioned hard work for <strong>24 years</strong> !<p><br></p>FastTek Global is a financially strong, privately held company that is <strong>100% consultant</strong> and <strong>client focused</strong> , operating in nearly half of the states in the U.S., Europe and India.<p><br></p>We've differentiated ourselves by being <strong>fast, flexible,</strong> <strong>creative</strong> and <strong> honest</strong> . Throw out everything you've heard, seen, or felt about every other IT Consulting company. We do unique things and we do them for Fortune 10, Fortune 500, and technology start-up companies.<p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p>Our benefits are second to none and thanks to our flexible benefit options you can choose the benefits you need or want, options include<p><br></p><ul><li>Medical and Dental (FastTek pays majority of the medical program)</li><li>Vision</li><li>Personal Time Off (PTO) Program</li><li>Long Term Disability (100% paid)</li><li>Life Insurance (100% paid)</li><li>401(k) with immediate vesting and 3% (of salary) dollar-for-dollar match</li></ul><p><br></p>Plus, we have a lucrative employee referral program and an employee recognition culture.<p><br></p>FastTek Global was named one of the <strong>Top Work Places</strong> in Michigan by the Detroit Free Press in <strong>2013, 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019</strong> , <strong>2020, 2021, and 2022!</strong><p><br></p>To view all of our open positions go to: https://www.fasttek.com/fastswitch/findwork<p><br></p>Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/fasttekglobal<p><br></p>Follow us on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/fasttekglobal<p><br></p>Find us on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/fasttek<p><br></p>You can become a fan of FastTek on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/fasttekglobal/
