title: Android Developer with Airlines Exp (Chicago or Houston)
description: <p><strong>Essential Functions:</strong></p><ol><li>Design circuits and Implement software of embedded devices and systems from requirements</li><li>Communicating and coworking with team members</li><li>Contribute to setting technical direction for products</li><li>Identify problems and drive creative solutions to fix them</li><li>Assists leadership with new ideas and concepts for improving products</li></ol><p><br></p><p><strong>Additional Responsibilities:</strong></p><ol><li>Manages times while ensuring deadlines and customer requirements are met</li><li>Maintains progress reports to allow management to monitor projects</li><li>Complies with Quality Management System requirements in accordance with ISO9001</li><li>Understands the whole product lifecycle</li><li>Other duties as assigned</li></ol><p><br></p><p><strong>Qualifications Guidelines</strong></p><p><br></p><p><strong>Required:&nbsp;</strong>Must have a Bachelor’s degree in Electrical/Electronic/Computer science Engineering or a related field. Minimum of 5 years work experience preferred in management.</p><p><br></p><p>&nbsp;<strong>Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:</strong></p><ul><li>Strong understanding of the hardware product development cycle</li><li>Working knowledge/experience in 8bit/16bit/32bit micro-processors, ARM core, Cortex-M0/M4, etc.</li><li>Proficiency with C or C++</li><li>Working knowledge/experience in RTOS (Keil RTX, rtlinux, FreeRTOS, etc.), DSP, multi-task programming, concurrency, IPC, event, etc.</li><li>Experience with peripheral interface chipset level program such as UART, SPI, I2C, CAN, PCI/PCIe, Ethernet, USB, Network protocols TCP/IP, UDP, etc.</li><li>Experience with circuit tools (Or-CAD, PADS, etc.), VHDL tools (Xilinx, Altera FPGA design tools, etc)</li><li>Experience with wireless devices such as Wi-Fi, Bluetooth and BLE, zigbee, etc.</li><li>Demonstrated proficiency in problem solving and implementing new or improved ideas</li><li>Should have solid technical background in creative product development</li><li>Requires extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals</li><li>Requires ability to understand verbal and/or written directions and instructions</li><li>Creative, resourceful, analytical, strong team player</li><li>Highly motivated self-starter with customer focus and energy to drive successful completions</li><li>Requires the ability to effectively communicate clearly with team members and other department members</li><li>A proven record of successful implementation of hardware/firmware solutions</li></ul><li><br></li><p><strong>Physical and Environmental Elements:</strong></p><p>This is primarily an office classification and employees work in an office with moderate noise levels, controlled temperature conditions and no direct exposure to hazardous physical substances. May work offsite in various environments; travel may be required. Finger dexterity is needed to access, enter and retrieve data using a computer keyboard, typewriter keyboard or calculator and to operate standard office equipment. Must be able to speak clearly and communicate clearly in English. The position occasionally bends, stoops, reaches, pushes and pulls drawers to retrieve and file information and lifts and carries reports, records, and other materials that typically weigh less than 30 pounds.</p><p><strong>Special Requirements/Certification:</strong></p><p>Electrical engineering side is preferred.</p><p><br></p><p><em>Lanco is an equal opportunity employer. All employment-related decisions, including but not limited to hiring, compensation, promotion, discipline (including termination), evaluation, training and development opportunities, etc., are made without discrimination on the basis of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender-related identity, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, religion, age, military status, protected disability, citizenship, genetic information or any other category protected by applicable law.</em></p>

title: Software Engineer - Ubuntu Systems Management
description: <ul><li>Lead developers working in C#, ASP.NET, .Net Core, JavaScript |Translate business requirements or needs into actionable software development<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>Our client was founded over 20 years ago in the Spectator Sports industry, gearing their platform to serve a wide array of youth sports organizations across the US. They're currently the leading provider of technology solutions for all of the youth sports teams in the US, operating web and mobile platforms with over 4M on-boarded users. Their main challenge now is merging their technology to integrate with a company they acquired, while continuing to maintain operation of their platforms with minimal downtime. These are high impact projects that enrich the experiences of youth athletes, and simplify scheduling, planning, and making payments for parents<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong><ul><li>Lead developers working in C#, ASP.NET, JavaScript - with the opportunity to jump in and code wherever necessary.</li><li>Translate business requirements or needs into actionable software development road maps and architecture.</li><li>Remain up to date with development breakthroughs and follows best practices.</li><li>Lead all discussions involving future developments, gaps in technology, external vendors and managing current software vendors.</li><li>Use, rework, and adapt existing web applications for mobile apps.</li><li>Create and test software prototypes when needed.</li><li>Perform daily stand-ups with team members to ensure optimal success and efficiency.</li><li>Take charge of development team without needing micromanagement from upper leadership.<br><br></li></ul><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship<br><br></strong><em>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br></em><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong><ul><li>5+ years of progressive experience in software development</li><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field.</li><li>Strong proficiency with C#, ASP.NET.</li><li>Strong profiency with JavaScript (AngularJs, ReactJs and/or VueJs)</li><li>Experience hands-on with React Native for mobile applications</li><li>Experience using SQL databases - either relational and/or non-relational experience.</li><li>Experience working with REST APIs.</li><li>Strong attention to detail, always looking to create robust solutions that minimize excess redundancies.</li><li>Excellent troubleshooting and communication skills.</li><li>Clear documentation.</li><li>A desire to have an impact on the world with the software being developed.</li><li>Interest in a hybrid model in the Highland Park office up to twice a week.<br><br></li></ul><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorshi</strong>p<br><br><strong>What's On Offer<br><br></strong><ul><li>Base salary very open for the right candidate, up to 190K depending on experience.</li><li>Affordable comprehensive health-care plans, with more than 80% of out of pocket costs covered.</li><li>401k with 4% company match, no waiting period for matched contributions.</li><li>Unlimited Paid Time Off program, with no expectations, thresholds, or strings attached (avg 5 weeks off)</li><li>Office closed last 2 weeks of the calendar year.</li><li>Person first model, i.e. you're a person before you're a developer allowing flexibility for when life just happens.</li><li>Dynamic culture, tech minded individuals looking to make a difference with their coding.</li><li>Mentorship, management, and leadership opportunities within.</li><li>On-boarding program to make the transition period run smoothly.</li><li>Optional outings to visit Chicago Sports teams, games, press events, networking events.<br></li></ul><strong>Contact: Daniela Rodríguez Flores<br><br></strong><strong>Quote job ref: JN-052023-6058482</strong>

title: Developer III
description: <strong>Summary<br><br></strong>This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and Web Services at scale. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.<br><br>Canonical's Store team develops and operates the backend services that power the Snap Store and Charmhub.io marketplaces. Our services are built primarily in Python, within a bit of Golang. If you have a passion for clean APIs, have a bias towards shipping and believe that tests are the key to higher velocity and reliability, you'll fit right in.<br><br>We have some exciting challenges ahead including continuing to scale our production architecture, expand the store backend to handle additional package types, and enhance our on-prem offering for IoT and Enterprise solutions.<br><br><strong>What You'll Do<br></strong><ul><li>Collaborate remotely with a globally distributed team. </li><li>Write clean web service APIs to support both CLI and web frontend clients, using Python (and optionally Golang). </li><li>Design and implement new features and enhancements from spec to production and ongoing operations at scale. </li><li>Review code and technical designs produced by other engineers. </li><li>Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions. </li><li>Work remotely with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Who You Are<br></strong><ul><li>You love technology and working with a diverse set of talented people. </li><li>You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable. </li><li>You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated. </li><li>You have a broad technology base but favor backend code and infrastructure. </li><li>You have proficiency developing public-facing APIs and web applications, preferably using Python and/or Golang. </li><li>You know your way around relational and non-relational databases and can effectively design data models that perform well, and tune queries to access them. </li><li>You are comfortable with Ubuntu as a development and deployment platform. </li><li>You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree. <br><br></li></ul><strong>About Canonical<br><br></strong>Canonical is a growing, international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu -- the world's #1 cloud operating system. Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu. Canonical is a unique tech company - global, remote-first, open source, with 700 professionals across 50 countries - we want to be the world's best, not biggest, global software company. With almost every team remote by default, Canonical sets the pace on the 21st-century digital workplace.<br><br><strong>What Canonical offers:<br></strong><ul><li>Work from home</li><li>Learning and development allowances</li><li>Competitive Salary</li><li>Annual compensation review</li><li>Recognition rewards</li><li>Generous annual leave</li><li>Paid maternity, paternity and sick leave</li><li>Priority Pass for travel</li><li>Exposure to international business and technology<br><br></li></ul><em>We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.<br><br></em>#stack<br><br>

Our services are built primarily in Python, within a bit of Golang. If you have a passion for clean APIs, have a bias towards shipping and believe that tests are the key to higher velocity and reliability, you'll fit right in.<br><br>We have some exciting challenges ahead including continuing to scale our production architecture, expand the store backend to handle additional package types, and enhance our on-prem offering for IoT and Enterprise solutions.<br><br><strong>What You'll Do<br></strong><ul><li>Collaborate remotely with a globally distributed team. </li><li>Write clean web service APIs to support both CLI and web frontend clients, title: Software Engineer - App Stores Backend (Remote)
description: Take your career to the next level as an embedded software engineer, using your expertise in embedded C and MATLAB/Simulink to develop advanced features for the off-highway autonomous vehicle industry and push the technology of flagship vehicles such as tractors, harvesters, combines, and excavators to the next level.<br><ul><li>Your Responsibilities:*</li><li>Design, develop, and test software for enterprise programming and infrastructure solutions</li><li>Operate in a scrum team environment on varying project scope and direction from a project lead</li><li>Support the team with concept, development and testing of solutions</li><li>Software:*</li><li>Embedded C/C++</li><li>MATLAB/Simulink</li><li>Qualifications:*</li><li>Demonstrated capability in software product development using C++, C, Python and scripting languages</li><li>Training or experience with Object-Oriented Analysis/Design (OOA/D) and multi-threaded systems</li><li>Experience that demonstrates you are a self-starter, and able to work well without close direction</li><li>Demonstrated capability performing in an engineering team environment and interfacing with engineers and personnel of other disciplines</li><li>Minimum of 2 years of software industry experience<br><br></li></ul>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: .NET Software Engineer – Chicago
description: If you are a current Chamberlain Group employee, please click here to apply through your Workday account.<p><br></p><strong>Job Summary</strong><p><br></p>This role is responsible for applying skilled knowledge to the design and development of embedded applications on hardware platforms. The focus in this role includes creation of technical specifications, application firmware design and development, and support for manufacturing and regulatory approval. Knowledge of basic software development practices and principles is required. An Engineer 3, Firmware must support their peers in day-to-day development activities and be able to troubleshoot platform defects of average complexity. This role will be responsible for both individual and team based software development activities.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Responsibilities: </u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design, develop, and implement application level firmware solutions to meet business needs</li><li>Work with stakeholders to understand functional requirements of systems to accurately develop designs, implementations and test cases</li><li>Design and develop application firmware using best practices that adhere to product specifications using an Agile development process</li><li>Create and maintain technical specifications as related to product development</li><li>Work with senior engineers to implement scalable designs and modular functional blocks that meet product requirements</li><li>Use design analysis techniques such as FMEA or rate monotonic analysis to validate software designs prior to implementation. Ability to accurately document an intended design is critical</li><li>Create unit test cases that accurately test interface functionality and responses to varied inputs both in and out of scope</li><li>Analyze, troubleshoot, and resolve firmware defects as found during bench, lab, and production QA testing</li><li>Apply software quality tools such as Lint, Understand, and other static and dynamic analysis tools to verify software releases meet quality and coding standards</li><li>Support regulatory engineering for FCC and other outside agency approval of end products</li><li>Support manufacturing on site during as needed for engineering and production builds</li><li>Manage own work to deliver according to project schedules; be accountable for delivery</li><li>Actively contribute to the adoption of software architecture, best practices, and technologies</li><li>Responsible for complying with the security requirements set forth by the Information Security team and the established ISO 27001 Security Roles, Responsibilities, and Authorities Document found in the ISMS Document Library</li><li>Comply with health and safety guidelines and rules; managers should also ensure compliance across their teams</li><li>Protect CGI’s reputation by keeping information confidential</li><li>Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, professional publications, establishing personal networks, and participating in professional societies</li><li>Contribute to the team effort by accomplishing related results and participating on projects as needed</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Job Requirements: </u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in computer engineering, computer science, or electrical engineering and minimum of three (3) years of job-related experience strongly preferred; or minimum of seven (7) years of job-related experience as defined above in the Essential Functions section</li><li>An advanced degree in directly applicable area of study may substitute for up to two (2) years of experience</li><li>Flexibility to travel up to 10% of time; international travel required</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications:</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to work within a cross functional teams to create electro-mechanical products, understanding and participation in Scrum and Agile methodology; strong analytical skills; effective communication skills; ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment; object Oriented programming experience; TCP, UPD, HTTP, WebSockets, MQTT or other connected protocols</li></ul><p><br></p>We're an organization who values its human capital and provides support to assist its employees succeed.<p><br></p>Chamberlain Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. You will be considered for this position based upon your experience and education, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, ancestry; marital, disabled or veteran status. We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce environment that is free from any form of discriminations or harassment.<p><br></p>Persons with disabilities who anticipate needing accommodations for any part of the application process may contact, in confidence Recruiting@Chamberlain.com.<p><br></p>NOTE: Staffing agencies, headhunters, recruiters, and/or placement agencies, please do not contact our hiring managers via email or phone or other methods.

title: .NET Software Engineer – Chicago
description: *Position is Bonus eligible*<p><br></p>Prestigious Financial Company is currently seeking a DevOps Kubernetes Engineer. Candidate will be joining the DevOps team and supporting the development efforts for a team that strives for goals that refine and automate the processes needed to support the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Enable development teams to self-service build and deployment processes through process automation.</li><li>Design and implement process improvements across the build, deployment, and monitoring of Clearing applications.</li><li>Support the maintenance and configuration of development environments in Kubernetes and AWS.</li><li>Develop and support Terraform, Ansible, Harness, and Jenkins jobs used to instantiate and manage development environments.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Understanding of Kanban and/or Agile methodologies</li><li>Able to succeed in fast-paced environment with frequent changes</li><li>Comfortable communicating with both technical and non-technical audiences</li><li>Self-starter - takes the initiative to research, learn and deliver</li><li>Team player - humble, collaborative, and focused on making sure the entire team succeeds</li><li>Programming/Scripting experience in languages like Java, Bash, Python or Go is required.</li><li>Knowledge and experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) tools (examples - GitHub, Jenkins, Artifactory, Docker, Compose, K8s).</li><li>Java development experience is desirable.</li><li>Experience with distributed message brokers like Kafka, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, Amazon Kinesis, etc.</li><li>Experience with cloud technologies and migrations is required.</li><li>Experience preferred with AWS foundational services like VPCs, Security groups, EC2, RDS, S3 ACLs, KMS, AWS CLI and IAM etc.</li><li>Experience developing and delivering technical solutions using public cloud service providers like Amazon, Google, etc.</li><li>Familiarity with monitoring related tools and frameworks like Splunk, ElasticSearch, Prometheus, AppDynamics. Working knowledge of DevOps tools. Eg Terraform, Ansible, Jenkins, Kubernetes, Helm and CI/CD pipeline etc. is required.</li><li>Experience with RESTful APIs and JSON RPC. Experience following Git workflows.</li><li>BS degree in Computer Science, similar technical field, or equivalent experience</li><li>1+ years of experience in building large scale, data-centric solutions</li><li>3+ years of experience (recent) participating on a DevOps team or as product owner for DevOps team</li></ul>

GitHub, Jenkins, Artifactory, Docker, Compose, K8s).</li><li>Java development experience is desirable.</li><li>Experience with distributed message brokers like Kafka, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, Amazon Kinesis, etc.</li><li>Experience with cloud technologies and migrations is required.</li><li>Experience preferred with AWS foundational services like VPCs, Security groups, EC2, RDS, S3 ACLs, KMS, AWS CLI and IAM etc.</li><li>Experience developing and delivering technical solutions using public cloud service providers like Amazon, Google, etc.</li><li>Familiarity with monitoring related tools and frameworks like Splunk, ElasticSearch, Prometheus, AppDynamics. Working knowledge of DevOps tools. Eg Terraform, Ansible, Jenkins, Kubernetes, Helm and CI/CD pipeline etc. is required.</li><li>Experience with RESTful APIs and JSON RPC. Experience following Git workflows.</li><li>BS degree in Computer Science, similar technical field, or equivalent experience</li><li>1+ years of experience in building large scale, data-centric solutions</li><li>3+ years of experience (recent) participating on a DevOps team or as product owner for DevOps team</li></ul>

title: .NET Software Engineer – Chicago
description: <strong>Overview<br><br></strong><strong> PLS ® : People. Location. Service <br><br></strong>PLS—which stands for People – Location - Service—is a leading retail provider of alternative financial services. The PLS Group, headquartered in Chicago, is comprised of over 200 financial service centers in 12 states. Through our check cashing stores, we provide consumers with convenient financial products and services to help them manage their day-to-day financial needs. Although many of our customers have banking relationships, we believe that our customers use our financial services because they are convenient, transparent, and frequently more affordable than available traditional alternatives. PLS was founded in 1997 by Bob and Dan Wolfberg, who serve as Co-Presidents.<br><br><strong>Position Overview</strong><strong>:<br><br></strong>The Quality Assurance Analyst will support the quality assurance effort within Customer Financial Solutions by systematically reviewing customer interactions and applying established quality standards to approved quality scorecards. The aim of the Quality Assurance effort is to ensure that quality assurance is applied in an independent, objective and neutral manner. The goal is to improve the customer experience, and overall quality of Customer Solution Specialist’s interactions with the customer. The QA analyst also plays a key role in minimizing company exposure by the reduction of business risk through continuous improvement of business processes and adherence to corporate and Collection policies and procedures.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br><br></strong><strong>Job Responsibilities</strong><strong>:<br></strong><ul><li> Complete 100% of scheduled monthly quality reviews. </li><li> Participate in calibration session with CFS leadership to review performance and consistency of scoring. </li><li> Review performance at the supervisor/manager level to ensure each area/individual has the knowledge and skills required to effectively deliver on the established service commitments. </li><li> Gauge the performance of Customer Financial Solutions while providing feedback relative to compliance initiatives. </li><li> Must be able to highlight areas of risk via QA reports. </li><li> Periodically audit service results of supervisors for compliance and consistency. </li><li> Provide tracking and reporting of Quality Assurance metrics. </li><li> Create weekly, monthly, semi-annual and annual reporting for management review. </li><li> Work with training department to identify training needs. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications<br><br></strong><strong>Job Requirements</strong><strong>:<br></strong><ul><li> Bachelor's Degree in relevant field is preferred; additional years of relevant experience may be considered in lieu of a degree </li><li> 1-3 years’ experience in customer quality assurance or quality control required, which includes performing QA for a Collection or Call Center </li><li> Working knowledge of multifunctional call recording quality monitoring solutions (voice and screen capture) </li><li> Previous blended (voice, email, and chat) Contact Center quality quantification experience preferred </li><li> Excellent verbal and written communication skills </li><li> Strong listening, analytical and research skills <br><br></li></ul><strong>Physical Requirements:<br></strong><ul><li> Must be able to sit and/or stand for long periods of time. </li><li> Ability to lift 15 lbs. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Benefits:<br><br></strong>Benefits for eligible employees include medical/dental/vision, 401k, vacation, opportunities for advancement, on-going training available.<br><br><strong>We strive to demonstrate our Core Values in all positions at PLS:<br><br></strong>Communication<br><ul><li>Customer Focus</li><li>Integrity and Trust</li><li>Teamwork</li><li>Results<br><br></li></ul>PLS Financial Services is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, marital status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. PLS Financial Services will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. PLS Financial Services is a drug-free workplace. PLS provides reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application and hiring process, please notify your Recruiter or a member of our Human Resources team talentacquisition@PLS247.com to make arrangements. The decision on granting reasonable accommodation will be made on a case-by-case basis.<br><br>For jobs located in the City of Los Angeles, consistent with the requirements of the Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment

description: <ul><li>NET Software Engineer, .NET 7 – Social Networking Site – Chicago</li></ul><p><br></p>(Tech stack: .NET Software Engineer, .NET 7, C#, Web API 2, Entity Framework, Microservices, Azure, Programmer, Full Stack Developer, Architect, .NET Software Engineer)<p><br></p>Our client is the world’s largest social-networking web site and they have ambitions to become the biggest web site in the world! Their global presence currently stretches across 25 countries and their planned expansion for the next 12 months will see another 10 countries added to this list as well as their workforce increasing by 100% in size. Underpinning this success is their hip and cutting-edge .NET / C# technology platform.<p><br></p>We are seeking several .NET Software Engineer to work on the development of revolutionary new features that will draw users to their web site for longer periods of time. .NET Software Engineer applicants should have a skill set that encompasses: .NET, .NET Core / ASP.NET MVC, C# and SQL Server. Additionally you will follow an official structured career progression program.<p><br></p><strong>Location:</strong> Chicago, Illinois, USA / Remote Working<p><br></p><strong>Salary:</strong> $140,000 – $170,000 + Bonus + Benefits<p><br></p>Noir continues to be the leading Microsoft recruitment agency; we can help you make the right career decisions!<p><br></p>NOIRUSANETREC<p><br></p>NOIRUSAREC

title: Software Engineer - Low-Level Device Driver
description: CNH Industrial is a world-class equipment and services company dedicated to advancing the noble work of agriculture and construction workers. Driven by our shared purpose of Breaking New Ground, we are passionate about bringing Innovation, Sustainability, and Productivity to all that we do. As a truly global company, CNH Industrial’s 37,000+ employees form part of a diverse and inclusive workplace, focused on empowering customers to grow, and build, a better world through our core brands: Case IH, STEYR, New Holland Agriculture, CASE, and New Holland Construction.<p><br></p>In Precision Technology, we make iron smarter. Our team members deliver innovative solutions helping our customers to be more productive, save time, lower costs, and to operate sustainably. From vehicle displays, application controls, steering solutions, digital services and telematics, to fully autonomous driverless technology, we develop solutions that solve challenges for customers around the world.<p><br></p>Design, develop, and evaluate software for embedded systems from concept through production stage, and make modifications as needed.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p>Duties: The Embedded Software Engineer at CNH Industrial America LLC in Burr Ridge, IL will be responsible for developing software for CNH Industrial’s onboard Electronics Control Units (ECUs) for Precision Agriculture and Construction Equipment products; developing middleware infrastructure software components such as communication stacks and power management stacks for the onboard controllers; participating in system and software vehicle architecture reviews and providing mentorship for junior developers; designing, developing, testing, debugging and implementing operating systems components, software tools, and utilities using best practice software development processes and code; determining systems software design requirements; conferring with management, production, and marketing staff to determine engineering feasibility, cost effectiveness, and customer demand for new and existing software products; coordinating field testing of software products and systems; communicating with vehicle platforms to provide regular updates of software development activities and progress; documenting and demonstrating solutions by developing documentation, flowcharts, and diagrams to support problem analysis; developing clear and concise well-structured and documented source code applicable for software re-use across multiple controllers; participating in requirements, design, and source code reviews; maintaining released code, as needed; and identifying and implementing opportunities for software process and development cycle time improvements. May telecommute up to three days a week. Salary: $132,710 - $ 163,300 /year.<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p>Minimum Requirements: Requires a Bachelor's degree in Electrical or Electronic Engineering or closely related field plus five years of embedded system development experience. The five years of experience must include five years of experience with each of the following: 1) working on software applications to support the development of platform and core software; 2) C, C++ for drivers, middleware, application development; 3) designing, developing, testing and implementing operating system components, software tools and utilities; 4) defining system software design requirements; 5) coordinating field testing of software products and systems; 6) maintaining code and releases and developing structured document source code for re-use across other controllers; 7) identifying and implementing software process and development cycle time improvements.<p><br></p>CNH Industrial America LLC' s ongoing employee referral program does apply to this position.<p><br></p>Interested candidates should apply online at http://cnhindustrial.com/<p><br></p>CNH Industrial offers a wide variety of benefits that not only encourages wellness and preventative care, but we also provide the right tools and programs to help you achieve it. Our benefits package includes medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance. Our industry leading 401k will support you in meeting your retirement objectives. Additional benefits include paid parental leave, flexible work policies, opportunities for self-development and paid leave for specific activities. Click here for more information!<p><br></p><strong> EEO </strong><p><br></p>US applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Applicants can learn more about their rights by viewing the federal "EEO is the Law" poster and its supplement here . CNH Industrial participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. You can view additional information here.<p><br></p>If you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please contact us at narecruitingmailbox@cnhind.com.<p><br></p>Read about our company’s commitment to pay transparency by clicking this link: pay transparency notice .<p><br></p>Canada applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, nationality, place of origin, disability, marital status, family status, age, or any other ground prohibited by applicable provincial human rights legislation.

They specialise in delivering innovative .NET technology based business solutions to investment banks, financial services companies, prestigious music/media label and many more. They are about to embark on one of the most ambitious .NET development projects since the birth of the .NET framework.<p><br></p>We are seeking several .NET Software Engineer with an extensive array of talent and expertise. .NET Software Engineer will be given complete ownership of your business area and the opportunity to work on the full project life cycle. .NET Software Engineer applicants should have a skill set that encompasses some or all of the following: .NET, .NET Core / ASP.NET MVC, C# and SQL Server. Knowledge of software development methodologies is of interest (Agile, Scrum). My client will provide training in: .NET 7, JavaScript, React, Angular 14, Microservices, MongoDB, Vue.js, TypeScript, Azure, AWS, Web API 2, Entity Framework, Node.js, Elasticsearch, Agile, TDD, BDD, Scrum, Kanban and SQL Server 2022.<p><br></p>This is a truly exciting project, one which if you are given the opportunity to work on will do wonders for your resume and boost you into the IT super league!<p><br></p>Our client is looking to secure and retain the services of the very best .NET Software Engineer candidates on the market place, as such they are offering a challenging role and working environment, industry recognized training, guaranteed career progression and above market rate salaries.<p><br></p><strong>Location:</strong> Chicago, Illinois, USA / Remote Working<p><br></p><strong>Salary:</strong> $80,000 – $110,000 + Bonus + Benefits<p><br></p>Noir continues to be the leading Microsoft recruitment agency; we can help you make the right career decisions!<p><br></p>NOIRUSANETREC<p><br></p>NOIRUSAREC

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description: Sargent &amp; Lundy is one of the most experienced full-service architect-engineering firms in the world. Founded in 1891, the firm is a global leader in power and energy with expertise in grid modernization, renewable energy, energy storage, nuclear power, and fossil fuels. Sargent &amp; Lundy delivers comprehensive project services—from consulting, design and implementation to construction management, commissioning and operations/maintenance—with an emphasis on quality and safety. The firm serves public and private sector clients in the power and energy, gas distribution, industrial, and government sectors.<br><br><strong> Our Core Values <br><br></strong>Every decision we make is guided by our core values. By upholding these six principles, we support our clients, employees, and community. They are the compass we follow as we continue to grow our business and lead the industry.<br><br><strong>Quality </strong><strong>– </strong>We provide high-quality deliverables and services through an uncompromising focus on peer review, safety, and continuous improvement.<br><br><strong>Accountability </strong><strong>–</strong> Our actions demonstrate the highest levels of professionalism, integrity, and respect.<br><br><strong>Our People </strong><strong>– </strong>We value diverse perspectives, encourage professional growth, and are committed to providing a work community where people thrive. Our work is challenging but rewarding.<br><br><strong>Our Clients</strong><strong> – </strong>We deliver value and exceed our clients’ expectations through outstanding customer service, personal accessibility, and clear communication.<br><br><strong>Innovation </strong><strong>–</strong> Since 1891, we have invested in the people, training, tools, and technology needed to quickly adapt in a constantly changing world.<br><br><strong>Meaningful Impact </strong><strong>– </strong>We make a positive impact in the communities where we work and live.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>Sargent &amp; Lundy is seeking a highly motivated and collaborative individual like you to join our team! We currently have an opening for an experienced Developer to utilize and expand your web-based development skills .<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Collaborate with team other IT professionals and end users in developing code to build and integrate home grown and commercial applications </li><li> Coordinate internal customer requirements, build a programmatic solution, test the deliverable, and document what was done </li><li> Continuously learn and present new techniques learned at Communities of Practice to other development staff </li><li> Evaluate and recommend open source and other add-ins that will shorten development times <br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li> Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, or related field </li><li> Three to five years of proven experience in full stack development </li><li> Strong problem solving and excellent verbal/written communication skills to effectively to collaborate with others </li><li> C# and Visual Studio </li><li> HTML, JavaScript, JSON </li><li> Microsoft Azure (Portal and DevOps) </li><li> Azure Functions and APIM </li><li> SOAP and Rest APIs </li><li> SQL Server <br></li></ul><strong><u>Knowledge Of The Following Would Be a Plus<br></u></strong><ul><li> Active Directory </li><li> ASP.NET Core Web APIs </li><li> REACT </li><li> JAVA using Eclipse <br></li></ul><strong> We do not sponsor employees for work authorization in the U.S. for this position. <br><br></strong>Sargent &amp; Lundy is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any protected status as defined by law.

title: Full Stack Software Engineer
description: <strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Our team is responsible for building out pages and applications for our Hospitality Client's Loyalty program,<p><br></p>Candidate will be expected to contribute immediately building applications in React and Node JS. title: .NET Software Engineer, .NET 7, C# – Internet Icon – Chicago
description: *We are unable to sponsor for this permanent Full time role*<p><br></p>*Position is bonus eligible*<p><br></p>Prestigious Financial Company is currently seeking a SDET Software Development Engineer. Candidate will be creating, maintaining and executing automation test plans, writing code against software platforms, estimating testing efforts, analysing and communicating test results, defect tracking and participation in day-to-day acceptance test activities, and contribute to the company's performance and scalability testing efforts.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Collaborating with others to deliver complex projects which may involve multiple systems</li><li>Continuously thinking about the next steps while improving yourself and others around you</li><li>Contribute to our long-term vision and strategy for improved quality via automation</li><li>Develop, enhance and extend automation frameworks</li><li>Identify quality tasks during team sprint cycle and implement automation for new features</li><li>Analyze and communicate test results and defect tracking</li><li>Participate in performance and load test efforts</li><li>Assist in the planning, creation and control of the test environments and test data</li><li>Define test strategy, conduct requirements analysis for testability, identify scope, conduct risk and mitigation planning, configuration management planning, write master and detailed test plans for test planning and design.</li><li>Participate in the review of acceptance test procedures and processes and provide recommendations for improvements to eliminate redundancies in testing and improve efficiency.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>The requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the primary functions.</li><li>BS degree in Computer Science, similar technical field or equivalent experience</li><li>3+ years of technical experience building automated solutions within regulated industries</li><li>1+ years of within a leadership or senior role on cross-functional engineering teams</li><li>Experience working in an Agile environment</li><li>Hands-on experience with writing automation test code and utilizing leading industry standards tools and frameworks that can simulate complex multi-system scenarios</li><li>Proficiency with automated testing types (Unit, Functional, Load, Security, Behavioral, Integration, Component, Contract and End to End)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Technical Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Proficiency with automated testing types (Unit, Functional, Load, Security, Behavioral, Integration, Component, Contract and End to End)</li><li>Experience working with two or more of the following: web/mobile application development, Unix/Linux environments, event driven systems, transaction processing systems, distributed and parallel systems, large software systems development, security software development, public-cloud platforms</li><li>Automated Testing framework experience (Cucumber, Selenium, Mocha/Chai, TestNG)</li><li>BS degree in Computer Science, similar technical field or equivalent experience</li><li>3+ years of technical experience building automated solutions within regulated industries</li><li>1+ years of within a leadership or senior role on cross-functional engineering teams</li><li>Excellent Oral and written communication skills</li><li>Java based software development experience</li><li>Fluent in object-oriented design, industry best practices, software patterns, and architecture principles</li><li>Automated testing framework experience</li><li>Financial markets work experience, knowledge of trade and settlement life cycle.</li></ul>

title: Lead .Net Developer
description: <strong>Description: We have an opportunity for a Fullstack developer! If you are an EXPERT full stack developer actively looking for a role please apply</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>this role does require onsite availability at least one day a week</li></ul><p><br></p>We are seeking a Full Stack Software Engineer with a Back-End emphasis, that is capable of delivering a project from start to finish. This person will be responsible for Cloud/Server based software development featuring the Linux, Postgres, Golang/C/C++, Swagger/RESTAPI, ReactJS. This role is expected to provide strong technical leadership and mentor less experienced members within the framework of an Agile software development team. The Software Engineer must exhibit a strong sense of ownership regarding the technical solutions arrived at when implementing complex software designs. The work involves the full complement of software life cycle development activities required to deploy high quality software that meets the requirements of our aerospace customers.<p><br></p><strong><u>The Candidate Will Be Working In</u></strong><p><br></p>React for the U.I.<p><br></p>Go (Golang or Go programming) for the back-end<p><br></p>C/C++ experience could be good enough if someone doesn't have Golang<p><br></p>The candidate will also be responsible for database architecture and SQL programming.<p><br></p>The candidate will have the opportunity to mentor others and assign work.<p><br></p>The candidate needs to understand full stack development from start to finish and be able to deliver an end product / website<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p>Participate in software development activities including requirement specification, design definition, code implementation, system integration and test<p><br></p>Generate software lifecycle documentation to support certification of products<p><br></p>Integrate and debug Linux Server based software executing on Servers in Cloud based environments<p><br></p>Participate and contribute to Sprint Planning, Backlog grooming, Sprint Demos.<p><br></p>Perform and/or provide guidance for verification activities including test definition, test development and testing methods<p><br></p>Work daily in Azure DevOps to do requirements analysis, requirement derivation, create User Stories and Task,<p><br></p>Perform Code Reviews<p><br></p>Establish test frameworks to implement Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (CI/CD)<p><br></p>Enhance Linux based systems by studying the latest open source software<p><br></p>Utilize avionics standards such as ARINC and RTCA in the development testing<p><br></p><strong><u>About Actalent</u></strong><p><br></p>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions.<p><br></p>The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.
